###Chapter 1

"Are you nervous to see me?"

Anna Ross stared at the figure in the black suit approaching her, her back ramrod straight.

She never expected to run into her ex, Adrian Sinclair, at the family dinner hotel arranged by her stepfather.

"You—"

She instinctively stepped back, but before she could finish, he had already seized her wrist, slamming her against the cold tiles of the restroom wall.

"Three years apart, and you can worm your way into an event like this? Anna Ross, I underestimated you."

His warm breath brushed her cheek. Adrian looked lazy, but his eyes held a frosty chill. "Who's your sponsor now? Do tell."

"I don't have one!"

Her eyelashes fluttered as she denied it vehemently. Adrian abruptly tightened his grip around her waist.

He lowered his head, biting the soft skin of her neck, his voice low and dangerous. "Why pretend with me? I know exactly what you're like."

Pain spread from her neck. Humiliated and furious, Anna struggled desperately to break free, but she feared her family in the private room next door would notice the commotion.

She could only hiss in a low voice, though it trembled badly. "Let go! Are you insane?"

The corner of Adrian's mouth lifted. Noticing her panicked glances toward the door, he increased the pressure of his hold. The platinum ring set with a sapphire on his finger swayed slightly.

So afraid of being seen?

What kind of man is she with now?

Remembering her resolute breakup three years ago, and recalling how he had just seen her step out of a Mercedes-Benz behind a portly, older man, a dark fury surged in his eyes. His hand abruptly pushed up her skirt.

"Serving an old man is worse than being with me. I'll double whatever he pays you."

His fingers pressed against her inner thigh. The cold gemstone made her shudder. "Or do you prefer older men?"

"Shut up!"

Anna's chest heaved. She raised her hand and slapped him hard across the face.

After all these years, this man's words were still so vicious and cruel! Absolutely hopeless!

The crisp sound of the slap echoed. His handsome, arrogant face reddened instantly.

Adrian's eyes darkened. He pressed his tongue against his cheek, his fingers suddenly clenching.

"You're willing to latch onto an old man for money, but you play the innocent with me?"

He pinned her wrist with one hand, bending to press her against the sink. He bit her lip harshly, his large hand moving directly toward her waist.

Anna fought back frantically, but it was useless.

The butler had said the family dinner was about to start when he picked her up. If she didn't appear soon, the Lowell family would come looking. If they saw this scene, how could she and her mother ever face them?!

Her eyes reddened, but she didn't dare cry out for help. She could only press her knee against him, trying to stop his advance.

But his hand had already slipped under her skirt...

"Don't!"

Tears rolled down Anna's cheeks. She bit her lip until it bled. Adrian watched with mockery in his eyes, his fingers hooking onto the flimsy fabric, ready to tear it away.

Her heart turned to ash. Suddenly, a phone rang.

The man glanced at the caller ID on the screen. His eyes turned cold. He finally released her and turned to answer the call.

She couldn't hear what was said, but Anna clearly felt the chilling aura around him intensify. He let out a cold laugh and responded indifferently. "Right away."

Hanging up, he gave her a deep look before turning and leaving.

Shaken, Anna hurriedly straightened her clothes.

Her phone vibrated on the vanity. She composed herself and answered. Her mother's dissatisfied voice came through. "Where are you? The butler said he picked you up ages ago. Does it take half an hour to fix your makeup? All your father's relatives are here, waiting just for you. Is this appropriate?"

Anna cursed Adrian a thousand times in her heart. "I'm coming now."

After hanging up, she confirmed she looked presentable and walked into the adjacent private room with feigned composure.

But when she saw the figure next to her stepfather, her heart clenched violently!

Adrian Sinclair sat at the head of the table, his expression indifferent, leisurely wiping his fingers with a napkin. Though casual, he exuded the noble air of someone in power.

Why was he here?!

"Anna's here? Let me introduce you, sweetheart."

Her stepfather, Howard Lowell, smiled insincerely and waved her closer. "This is your eldest cousin, Adrian Sinclair. Coincidentally, you both attended Stanford. He was two years ahead of you."

Then he looked at Adrian, piling on a fake smile. "Adrian, you're close in age. Get to know each other better in the future."

Anna kept her head down, not daring to look up. She felt the man's gaze on her, cold and piercing.

The corner of Adrian's mouth lifted. His eyes swept over her and Howard, a hint of a mocking smile playing on his lips. "Oh? So this is the little cousin brought by the new wife my uncle just married?"

He rubbed the sapphire on his ring, his tone meaningful. "And my alumni... What a remarkable coincidence."

Anna's pupils constricted.

Adrian Sinclair was the ruthless, merciless eldest nephew her stepfather had spoken of?

She knew the Lowell family was powerful. Howard was the only son of the family patriarch, with two younger sisters.

But the current acting CEO of Lowell Enterprises was Howard's eldest nephew.

The patriarch believed his son was useless and his daughters only knew how to enjoy themselves. He originally wanted to assess the grandchildren, but Howard was diagnosed with a low sperm count. Neither of his wives had borne children.

The hope of inheriting the family business fell on the outstanding grandson from a young age.

Naturally, Howard was unwilling. He secretly obstructed his nephew while trying every possible way to have an heir.

Otherwise, her mother couldn't have married into the Lowell family while pregnant, bringing her, the extra baggage, along.

Their eyes met. Anna looked into his icy gaze, clenched the hem of her dress, and lowered her head further.

Howard didn't suspect anything, only thinking his timid stepdaughter was embarrassingly inept. He frowned slightly.

"What's wrong with you? Your father is introducing family, and you don't even say hello?"

Seeing the tense atmosphere, Vivian Lowell hurried forward to smooth things over, protectively cradling her slightly swollen belly. She linked arms with Howard and grabbed Anna's hand, pinching her wrist covertly. She smiled at Adrian.

"Adrian, Howard often praises how capable you are. Anna is just shy. Please be understanding."

Adrian withdrew his gaze and gave a slight nod, his expression unreadable. "It's nothing. You're too kind, Aunt Vivian."

Red marks already showed on Anna's wrist from her mother's pinching. She forced herself to calm down and mustered a well-behaved smile. "Hello, Cousin Adrian."

No one noticed the dark glint in Adrian's eyes.

His relationship with Howard had always been strained. Ever since the patriarch appointed him CEO, this uncle had repeatedly set obstacles, even once intending to kill him.

He'd heard earlier that Howard had married a young wife who brought along extra baggage, but he hadn't paid it any mind. If not for the patriarch's order, he would never have come here.

When he saw Anna, he thought she was here with an older man. He never expected... she was his uncle's stepdaughter.

"You're too polite, cousin."

The smile on his lips deepened, his voice tinged with amusement. "I didn't know your identity earlier. My apologies for the offense in the restroom."

Both Vivian and Howard were stunned. Had these two already met?

Remembering Anna's long delay in the restroom, Howard looked thoughtfully at them. "Oh? What happened in the restroom?"

Anna met Adrian's teasing gaze, and her heartbeat suddenly accelerated.
###Chapter 2

She spoke first.

"It's nothing serious."

"Cousin accidentally bumped into me."

"My dress got wet."

"That's why we were delayed."

Howard Lowell looked at Adrian Sinclair.

His eyes held suspicion.

"Oh?"

Anna Ross tightened her fingers.

Her dress was wrinkled from her grip.

Her heart raced nervously.

She wasn't sure if Adrian would cooperate.

He was always reckless.

And he hated her so much.

He might directly accuse her of seduction.

Then she and her mother would be kicked out of the Lowell family.

In the silence.

She heard Adrian chuckle softly.

"It was my carelessness."

"I'll have someone send a few new dresses to my cousin later."

"As an apology."

Howard felt it was a bit strange.

But he didn't think too deeply about it.

Anna took after her mother.

She was beautiful and alluring.

But his nephew had high standards.

He never had women around him.

He was recently dating a high society heiress.

How could he possibly be interested in this girl?

He didn't think further.

He smiled to smooth things over.

"We're all family."

"It's just a dress."

"We can buy another one later."

Anna breathed a sigh of relief.

She lowered her head to avoid his gaze.

She didn't dare look at Adrian.

The family dinner officially began.

Howard and Vivian were both remarried.

She entered the family while pregnant.

The Lowells cared about their reputation.

They didn't make a big fuss.

Adrian attended on behalf of Grandpa Lowell.

Anna sat beside her mother.

She ate quietly.

Adrian was right across from her.

Next to Howard.

She always felt his gaze on her.

It was terrifying.

She didn't even dare raise her head.

She only hoped the dinner would end soon.

Howard suddenly spoke with a smile.

"Anna."

"Don't be shy."

"Talk more with the relatives."

"Although you're not my biological daughter."

"I felt a connection with you the moment I saw you."

His tone was kind.

"Even after your mother gives birth to your brother."

"I won't treat you unfairly."

"I'll definitely treat you as my own."

Anna looked up.

Her spine stiff.

She forced an obedient smile.

"Thank you, Dad."

She didn't understand Howard's intention.

But she quickly figured it out.

Howard looked at Adrian.

"Adrian."

"Although you're from the Sinclair family."

"You're also the eldest brother in this family."

"You'll need to take care of your younger siblings in the future."

"After your cousin is born."

"I'll need you to help him take over the Lowell family business."

"We can't let outsiders take advantage."

The dinner atmosphere instantly became awkward.

His words were entrusting.

But they mocked Adrian as an outsider.

Even if he was in power now.

He would have to return the Lowell Group to his son eventually.

Adrian paused the knife in his hand.

His thumb rubbed his index finger.

No emotion showed on his face.

But Anna knew.

He was angry.

"Uncle is indeed as Grandpa said."

"Magnanimous and tolerant."

"It's truly rare to be so accepting of a stepdaughter."

He wiped the corner of his mouth with a napkin.

He spoke with a smile.

"But Uncle has had no children for so long."

"The family finally has a younger generation."

"It's normal to be happy."

"If Aunt could add a considerate little darling."

"That would be a true blessing."

"If it's a little cousin."

"I will naturally nurture him well."

"With the same dedication Grandpa had for Uncle."

"To make him become exactly like Uncle."

These words sounded fine.

But they made Howard's face tremble with anger.

This damned brat.

Was still so sharp-tongued.

Indirectly mocking him for not being able to have children.

Now he only had a stepdaughter.

And cursing him to have a daughter.

Even saying that having a son would be useless.

He trembled with anger.

But couldn't find fault.

He forced a stiff smile.

"Thank you for your kind words, Adrian."

Anna couldn't help but want to laugh.

She held it back.

Adrian was the first debater on Stanford's debate team.

Outwardly gentle and aloof.

His mouth was cutting and vicious.

A casually spoken sentence.

Could stab someone right in the heart.

The guests saw the tense atmosphere.

They quickly tried to smooth things over.

"President Lowell is having a child in his later years."

"The young master must be intelligent."

"Speaking of which."

"Mr. Sinclair is also twenty-five."

"Grandpa Sinclair has been arranging blind dates recently."

"Any plans to marry?"

Adrian looked up.

He glanced at Anna unintentionally.

He casually adjusted his cuff.

"Perhaps soon."

"I'll invite Uncle's family to honor us with your presence at the wedding."

He smiled at Anna.

The curve of his lips held an inexplicable meaning.

"Cousin hasn't been back to New York for a long time, right?"

"You must come then."

"Let me play host."

His tone was gentle and noble.

Like polite conversation between relatives.

But Anna heard a hint of mischief.

She clenched her palms.

She responded stiffly.

"Okay, Cousin."

The family dinner continued.

是 harmonious and joyful.

But the atmosphere was uncomfortable.

After it ended.

Anna excused herself to return to the company.

She wanted to leave quickly.

Adrian suddenly spoke.

"Cousin is returning to the company."

"We're going the same way."

"Take my car."

Same way?

Anna didn't know what way that was.

She instinctively felt he was up to something again.

She declined politely.

"No need to trouble Cousin."

"I'll take a taxi."

Adrian stood with his back to everyone.

His tall frame blocked her.

His tone was gentle.

But his eyes held mockery.

"Of course it's the same way."

"Grandpa asked me to check on the branch's operations."

"I heard Cousin just joined the company."

"Please give me an introduction later."

Anna couldn't find words to refuse.

Howard was incompetent.

But he was Grandpa Lowell's only son.

The Lowell Group couldn't be handed to him.

He could only manage the San Francisco branch.

Adrian was the CEO of the Lowell Group.

Inspecting the branch was not a problem.

But she didn't want to have anything to do with him.

A flash of panic crossed Howard's eyes.

He coughed.

"Then Adrian can take Anna."

"Anna."

"Show your cousin around San Francisco."

He separated the two.

He gave Anna a meaningful look.

He took her aside under pretext.

His tone was cold.

"When Adrian inspects later."

"Keep a close eye on him."

"Don't say anything unnecessary."

"I'll arrange for someone to handle it."

"Understood?"

"That little bastard can't stand to see me do well."

"If he finds any leverage."

"You and your mother won't have it easy either."

Anna lowered her head.

She responded obediently.

"I understand."

"Dad."

Howard nodded with satisfaction.

He let her leave with Adrian.

The man held the car door open politely.

Every movement was noble and gentle.

Anna got in the car.

She was nervous inside.

Worried he would cause trouble again.

Adrian remained silent the whole way.

He drove properly to the company.

Anna breathed a sigh of relief.

She took him upstairs.

"Mr. Sinclair, please look around yourself."

"I have work to attend to."

"I won't keep you company."

"The vice president will bring the quarterly report later."

She turned to leave.

Her wrist was grabbed by the man.

Adrian pulled her into his arms.

He locked the meeting room door.

He gripped her chin.

He smiled faintly.

His thin lips curved with mockery.

"Your father asked you to accompany me."

"Abandoning me like this."

"Aren't you afraid you can't explain?"

Feeling the warmth of his palm.

Anna realized something was wrong.

"Are you crazy?"

"This is the company!"

Adrian curled his lips.

He increased his grip.

Pulling her closer.

"Why are you nervous?"

"Is there a problem with the company?"

"Or do you think it's less exciting than the restroom?"

He pressed her against the door.

His palm stroked her neck.

"That old fool Howard."

"Would love for you to have a connection with me."

"A bait delivered to my doorstep."

"Wouldn't it be disrespectful not to bite?"

Anna's pupils contracted.

The hand on her neck tightened.

Adrian forced her to look up.

He bit her lip.

His palm pressed her wrist.

Trapping her between his arms.

"You're insane..."

The taste of blood spread.

Anna frowned in pain.

She instinctively bit back at his cool thin lips.
###Chapter 3

Adrian Sinclair tightened his grip.

He pulled her toward the sofa.

Leaning in close.

"Three years apart."

"You've grown quite a temper."

His palm pressed against her waist.

Rubbing through the fabric of her dress.

Anna Ross's breath hitched.

Her lips were sealed by his.

His hand wandered over her body.

Fingertips burning with heat.

"You curse so fiercely."

"Yet your body tells a different story."

"These three years."

"Did no man satisfy you?"

Anna's cheeks burned.

The meeting room felt suffocating.

A fine sweat dampened her back.

Her voice trembled.

"What do you want?"

"I'm your uncle's stepdaughter now!"

"How dare you—"

Adrian gave a low laugh.

His eyes darkened.

"A stepdaughter."

"Beyond my reach?"

"I don't even regard Howard Lowell."

"Much less you."

He nibbled her earlobe.

His hand moved toward her zipper.

"Just catching up."

"And settling our score from three years ago."

"Why resist?"

"In the past."

"You loved this the most."

The Ross family had fallen long ago.

The Sinclairs were New York's elite.

As the heir, Adrian had every right to arrogance.

But what did that have to do with her?

Three years ago, he was the one who spoke cruelly.

They had been broken up for years.

What gave him the right to seek revenge?

Anna raised her hand to strike.

He caught her wrist.

A sharp pain bloomed on her neck.

The zipper slowly descended...

Anna's eyes reddened.

Struggling was useless.

She bit her lip in despair.

A knock sounded at the door.

"Mr. Sinclair."

"I'm the vice president of the branch."

"Here to deliver documents."

"Are you available?"

Adrian paused.

Anna shoved him away.

She frantically adjusted her dress.

Her eyes blazed with fear and anger.

The man's lips curved.

His voice returned to cool detachment.

"Come in."

The vice president entered.

Meeting Adrian's icy gaze, he instinctively looked down.

"Mr. Sinclair."

He noticed Anna's disheveled state.

But didn't dare ask.

While the vice president reported, Anna quickly left.

She walked the streets for a long time.

When she finally gathered her thoughts, she stood outside the Lowell manor.

The night was deep.

Anxiety coiled in her chest.

If her stepfather learned she had left Adrian, he would take it out on her mother...

She hesitated.

Headlights suddenly flashed.

A black Maybach pulled up nearby.

Adrian stepped out.

Anna instinctively retreated.

He caught her wrist.

His voice was warm, almost amused.

"You've had a long day."

"Let me take you to dinner another time."

Anna froze.

The manor lights turned on.

The housekeeper greeted them with a smile.

"Miss Anna, Mr. Sinclair, you're back?"

"Madam and Mr. Lowell have been waiting."

Anna had no choice but to enter with him.

The living room was brightly lit.

Howard Lowell and her mother sat on the sofa.

Howard frowned.

"Why are you back so late?"

Anna's fingers trembled slightly.

Adrian calmly removed his coat.

"We visited the company."

"Then explored San Francisco."

"I was concerned for her safety alone."

"So I brought her home."

Howard relaxed.

He offered a false smile.

"Young people enjoy their fun."

"Thank you, Adrian."

"Stay the night."

"The housekeeper will prepare a guest room."

Anna's heart sank.

Adrian nodded in agreement.

He sat down comfortably.

"Grandpa wants me to meet Chloe Valentine."

"I may need to impose for a few days."

A flicker of suspicion crossed Howard's eyes.

But he couldn't refuse.

He instructed the housekeeper to prepare a room.

It happened to be right next to Anna's.

Anna paled.

Howard probed about company matters.

But Vivian Lowell watched her daughter.

Her eyes filled with alarm.

Distracted, Anna excused herself to go upstairs.

She was about to lock her door and wash up.

Her mother entered.

Vivian grabbed her hand.

Her voice shook.

"What happened with Mr. Sinclair?"

"What are those marks on your neck?"

Anna looked in the mirror.

A vivid love bite marred her neck.

Her heart turned cold.
###Chapter 4

"Oh, this..."

She quickly recovered, scratching the red mark nonchalantly. "I got bitten by a mosquito yesterday while accompanying Adrian on his walk."

"Is there a problem, Mother?"

Vivian Lowell stared intently into her daughter's eyes, finding nothing unusual, and finally relaxed a little.

"You should keep your distance from Adrian Sinclair."

She closed the door, lowering her voice. "Your uncle said that man appears gentle and noble on the surface, but he's ruthless and merciless at his core."

"The Sinclair family wasn't considered top-tier in New York originally. But since Adrian took over Sinclair Corp, he now dominates everything."

"The old master favors his decisiveness and intends to hand over the Lowell Corporation to him as well."

"He dares to use any means in business. A young girl like you is nothing but a blank page in his eyes!"

"Besides, he's now your nominal cousin. Don't you dare entertain any improper thoughts!"

Anna Ross lowered her eyes, answering obediently. "I know, Mom. If it weren't for... Dad's arrangements, I wouldn't have gone out with him either."

Vivian finally felt reassured and left after a few more words of advice.

Anna watched her mother leave, her nails digging deeply into her palms.

She couldn't afford to entangle with Adrian any longer.

Even if their breakup three years ago was unpleasant, he was now her cousin!

Neither the Sinclair nor the Lowell families would ever accept her. Moreover, Adrian's current behavior was clearly just to humiliate her!

If he was going to stay at the Lowell residence, then she had to leave...

After a moment's thought, Anna dialed her best friend's number. "Mia, are you still working in real estate? Can you help me find a suitable apartment? I want to move out as soon as possible..."

Unaware, footsteps approached outside her door. A man in a black suit stopped at her doorway, his gaze cold and gloomy.

By the time Anna finished her shower, it was already 1 a.m.

Drying her hair, she picked up her phone. The screen lit up with a text message from a number that hadn't appeared in a long time.

[S: Come to the room next door.]

Her fingertips trembled slightly.

It was all her fault for being soft-hearted back then... She hadn't had the heart to block him when they broke up!

She ignored the message and directly dragged the number into her block list.

But soon, her phone buzzed with an AirDrop notification.

Hesitating for a moment, she opened the image. A photo filled the screen.

In the picture, she lay on a sofa, her neck and ears flushed red.

A slender hand rested on her leg, the thumb adorned with a sapphire ring. It was Adrian's hand!

Anna's pupils constricted sharply.

When did he take such a photo?!

Trembling, she gripped her phone tightly, threw on a coat, and hurried out of her room.

The door to the adjacent room was slightly ajar. The manor was silent, only warm yellow light spilling from within.

Clenching her teeth, Anna pushed the door open.

Adrian had just emerged from the bath. His wet hair fell across his forehead, a towel wrapped around his waist. His broad shoulders and narrow waist were strikingly apparent, the usual sharpness softened, replaced by a lazy elegance.

Those eight-pack abs were still dripping water, enough to make anyone's heart race and cheeks flush.

"We're at home! Even if you disregard Uncle, do you not care about Grandpa Lowell at all?!"

Anna kept her voice low, demanding, "Adrian Sinclair, what exactly do you want? Aren't you going on blind dates? Why won't you let me go?"

A faint smile touched Adrian's lips. He reached out and pulled her into his embrace.

Anna struggled fiercely, but he restrained her, and they tumbled into the swimming pool.

Water flooded her nose and mouth, sending her into a fit of violent coughing.

Suddenly, her chin was gripped. Adrian kissed her lips forcefully.

"I want to sleep with you."

Her freshly changed clothes were soaked through, clinging to her body and outlining her alluring curves. Adrian's lips and teeth trailed downward, from her jaw to her neck, then biting open the strap behind her neck.

Dazed from the water, Anna leaned weakly against his chest.

"You think moving out will let you escape?"

Adrian nibbled on her earlobe, his voice lazy yet full of threat. "Once you leave the Lowell family, what do you think will hold me back?"

Anna's heart tightened.

Had he overheard her phone call with Mia?

Her heart sank bit by bit. She looked up at him, eyes red. "Then what do you want me to do? Isn't it enough that I won't stay here to be an eyesore? Mom already noticed. Do you have to push me to death to be satisfied?"

A mocking smile played on Adrian's lips. He increased his pressure, making her cry out in pain.

"Oh? She knows? Doesn't that make it more exciting?"

He released his bite, twirling her reddened earlobe carelessly. "If something like this happens, would your mother dare tell Howard Lowell? Tell him his stepdaughter seduced his nephew?"

Then, he added sarcastically, "Perhaps this is Howard Lowell's plan all along. If something happens between us, angering the old master, won't the Lowell Corporation fall into his hands?"

"By then, he might even thank you, his good daughter."

Anna's fingertips turned white, all color draining from her face.

Adrian was the old master's most favored grandson. Any family scandal would only be covered up for his sake.

And she, the stepdaughter, would only become the scapegoat, ruined and thrown out of the Lowell family!

Seeing her cease resistance, a flicker of disgust passed through Adrian's eyes. He stood up, pulled her from the pool, and threw her onto the floor.

"Weren't you so skilled at seducing men three years ago? Now you're stiff as a board?"

He looked down at her, playing with his ring mockingly. "Do you think being a Lowell stepdaughter makes you a千金小姐? Have you forgotten your old tricks?"

Anna's lips trembled. Watching him snort derisively, sit by the window, and light a cigarette, she shakily climbed up from the floor and fled through the door.

Adrian didn't follow.

Relieved, she ran back to her room to change, but sleep eluded her for a long time.

Early the next morning, after much hesitation, she went upstairs toward her mother's room.

Before she could knock, she heard a pained cry from inside.

Her heart clenched. She pushed the door open in a panic.

She saw her stepfather grabbing her mother's hair, slapping her hard across the face.

Blood trickled from the corner of her mother's mouth and nose, her eyes filled with terror and helplessness.

A chill ran down Anna's spine. Her eyes widened in fury!

She rushed forward, trying to pull her stepfather away. "Let go! Mom is pregnant with your child! How can you hit her?!"

"Get away from me! Damn liar! How dare you deceive me!"

Howard Lowell's eyes were bloodshot, like a mad bull. He shoved her away. "Pregnant? I've been fooled by this damned pillow... Vivian Lowell, you are utterly shameless and would stop at nothing!"

"Return all the bride price I gave when I married you! We're getting a divorce now! Or else you'll regret it!"

Disbelief flashed in Anna's eyes.

Her mother faked the pregnancy...?
###Chapter 5

Howard Lowell shot to his feet.

Anna Ross threw herself over her mother, shielding her.
Her voice trembled. "Mom, give him the money back. Let's just go."
She didn't want to stay here.
She wanted nothing more to do with Adrian Sinclair.

But Vivian Lowell clamped a hand over her daughter's mouth.
Her mother scrambled on her knees to Howard's feet. "Howard, I was wrong. I shouldn't have lied. Please, don't throw us out!"
"You bitch! You dare beg for mercy?"
Howard's chest heaved. He raised his foot to kick her.

Anna's knuckles turned white.
She tried to pull her mother up, but Vivian shoved her away.
"Howard, a divorce right after our marriage will hurt the company. How will you explain it to the old man?"
Vivian wiped the blood from her face, clutching his pant leg. "I had no other choice. I got sick three years ago, the debt was crushing. They were going to sell Anna if I didn't pay!"
"Think of how long she's called you Dad. Please, forgive us this once? I'll give you a son, I promise!"

Anna's arms shook.
So that was why her mother had married Howard.
Three years ago, her mother needed a kidney transplant.
The cost was astronomical.
She had scrambled for money, but it wasn't enough.
In desperation, she'd taken a loan from a loan shark.
For three years, Anna worked herself ragged to pay it back.
Then her mother suddenly met Howard and married into the Lowell family.
Anna had been happy for her, never intending to rely on the Lowells.
She never knew her mother married to settle the debt.

Howard stared at Anna, weighing his options.
After a long silence, his voice was cold. "You can stay. But I don't keep idle people around."
He kicked Vivian aside and walked over to Anna. "You and Adrian Sinclair get along well?"
At the mention of Adrian, Anna's heart clenched. She looked down. "No."
Howard rubbed his chin, thoughtful. "That boy never has women around. He invited you to the company himself. Even went shopping with you. That's rare for him."
"He has a blind date tonight at The Royal Lounge with the Valentine heiress. Hmph... The Sinclair old man wants him to establish himself in San Francisco and swallow up the Lowell family. I won't let him succeed."
"You will ruin that date. Do something. Make him do something to you, get evidence. I'll clear your mother's debt."

Anna's fingers twitched. She looked up, disbelief written on her face.

。。。。。。

Late at night, The Royal Lounge was unusually quiet.
Anna was led in through the staff entrance by the butler, her palms slick with cold sweat.
Beneath her black coat, she wore only a thong and a bra that left little to the imagination.
The butler took her to a private room, shoved a packet of powder into her hand, and left.
Anna sat on the sofa, her mind in turmoil.
She didn't want to be here, but her mother had begged her through tears.
Was she really going to drug him...?

As she wrestled with the decision, footsteps sounded outside the door.
Anna's heart seized. Instinctively, she hid in the attached restroom.
In her panic, the packet of powder fell onto the sofa.
Adrian Sinclair pushed the door open. The clean scent of orchids followed him in.

Their fingers barely touched before pulling away.

Mr. Klein awkwardly retracted his hand.

"Mr. Sinclair, please have a seat."
###Chapter 64

Adrian Sinclair gave a slight nod.

He took his seat with effortless composure.

Anna Ross immediately moved to stand at his side.

William Klein finally noticed the stunning beauty accompanying Adrian.

His gaze swept over Anna with greedy appraisal.

She felt a wave of discomfort.

She subtly shifted half a step behind Adrian.

After a brief exchange of pleasantries.

Adrian cut straight to the point.

"Mr. Klein, we've already discussed the project details over the phone."

"You insisted on a face-to-face meeting."

"Is there something about the proposal you're unsatisfied with?"

William paused while pouring wine.

He laughed evasively.

"Don't be so impatient, Mr. Sinclair."

"Let's discuss this over our meal."

He pushed a glass of wine toward Adrian.

Then downed his own drink first.

Adrian watched the glass with cold indifference.

He showed no intention of touching it.

"I simply want to know."

"What is your actual stance on this collaboration?"

William's attention drifted back to Anna.

He stroked his chin.

His smile was oily.

"Mr. Sinclair, I said we should take this slow."

"You've only recently taken over the company."

"There's still much for you to learn."

Anna recognized the deliberate condescension.

This man was clearly trying to undermine Adrian.

Adrian let out a cold laugh.

His eyes turned icy.

He toyed idly with his platinum signet ring.

After a long moment, he finally spoke.

"Mr. Klein, you should think before you speak."

Faced with this direct threat, William snorted dismissively at his assistant.

His expression was full of contempt.

As if mocking Adrian for overestimating himself.

He downed another glass of wine.

Then leered openly at Anna.

"If you're willing to let me have this beauty, Mr. Sinclair."

"We can sign the contract right now."

Anna's heart clenched.

Her knuckles turned white where she gripped the files.

She looked at Adrian.

Terrified he might actually offer her up.

She would rather die than go with this disgusting old man.

Seeing no reaction from Adrian, William stood and moved toward Anna.

He wore a nauseating smile.

"Even more beautiful up close."

"What's your name, sweetheart?"

He reached out to touch Anna's face.

She recoiled in disgust.

But backed into a wall with nowhere to retreat.

Just as William was about to lunge forward.

A powerful hand clamped around his wrist.

Looking up, Anna saw Adrian glaring darkly at William.

Before William could react.

A heavy fist connected with his face.

Several more blows followed in quick succession.

William cried out and collapsed to the floor.

The others gasped and crowded around.

Anna stood frozen in shock.

She never expected Adrian to intervene for her.

William tried to speak.

But Adrian kicked him hard in the chest.

Adrian's voice was frigid.

"Who do you think you are?"

"Overestimating your own importance?"

The others exchanged uneasy glances.

No one dared to make a sound.

Adrian straightened his collar.

Then took Anna's hand and walked out without looking back.

The deal had fallen through.

Anna felt a pang of guilt.

She apologized softly.

"I'm sorry. This is all because of me..."

Adrian suddenly stopped walking.

His cold eyes swept over her.

"Don't flatter yourself."

"If you weren't my Executive Assistant right now."

"I wouldn't have bothered."

Anna's face paled.

She bit her lip hard.

She shouldn't have expected anything from him.

Adrian's anger still radiated from him.

She didn't dare speak again.

She followed him silently back to the hotel.
###Chapter 65

Anna Ross stepped into the hotel lobby.

A figure in pale yellow bounded toward her.

She recognized the girl from this morning.

The girl affectionately looped her arm through Adrian Sinclair's.

Her smile was as bright as the morning sun.

Anna's fingers tightened slightly.

She felt like an awkward outsider.

Adrian noticed her distraction instantly.

He withdrew his arm, his expression cool.

"Mind your surroundings."

His voice gave nothing away.

The girl finally looked at Anna.

A flicker of admiration passed through her eyes.

She studied Anna with curiosity.

"What's your relationship?"

Adrian's gaze swept over them.

"Executive Assistant."

He answered with detached ease.

The girl raised a brow, clearly skeptical.

She had seen him stealing glances at Anna.

She stepped forward and extended her hand.

"I'm Sophia Roscente."

Anna was slightly surprised.

She shook hands politely.

"Anna Ross."

A faint curve touched her lips.

Sophia nodded, satisfied.

She returned to Adrian's side and took his arm.

Rising on her toes, she whispered near his ear.

"Cousin, do you like this pretty lady?"

Adrian's brow twitched almost imperceptibly.

His peripheral glance brushed Anna's profile.

"Don't cause trouble."

His voice dropped low.

"Or I'll send you home."

Sophia pouted in displeasure.

But her eyes soon sparkled as she tugged his sleeve.

"I'm hungry."

"Take me to eat, please?"

Adrian gave a faint hum of agreement.

Sophia immediately beamed with joy.

Anna watched their intimate posture.

A subtle ache bloomed in her chest.

She quickly suppressed the emotion.

At least she could leave work early.

She thought of Chloe Valentine.

The official fiancée was probably still kept in the dark.

She shook her head lightly, dismissing the thought.

"May I clock out now?"

Sophia observed their interaction.

A knowing smile played on her lips.

She was certain her cousin treated his assistant specially.

Adrian's cold gaze shifted to Anna.

"Join us for dinner."

His tone brooked no argument.

Anna instinctively stepped back.

"I don't want to be a third wheel."

She refused directly.

Adrian's expression darkened instantly.

He closed the distance between them.

"It's still work hours."

"Are you attempting to leave your post, Miss Ross?"

Anna's heart fluttered nervously.

He clearly had a companion already.

Why was he singling her out?

She lowered her eyes without responding.

Adrian's voice grew deeper.

"Did you not hear me?"

Every word carried undeniable pressure.

Sophia watched with keen interest.

Her cousin was clearly being contradictory.

His insistence on keeping Anna there was downright domineering.
###Chapter 66

Sophia Roscente stepped forward.

She spoke softly. "You should come with us. I don't mind."

Her words pierced Anna Ross's heart like needles.

A sharp pain shot through her.

She wanted to flee this place immediately.

But Adrian Sinclair gave her no chance to escape.

She could only agree in a low voice. "Alright."

Adrian remained silent.

Sophia affectionately linked arms with him, walking ahead.

Anna followed quietly behind them.

A long distance stretched between the three of them.

Halfway there.

Sophia leaned close to Adrian's ear.

She said mysteriously, "Cousin, just admit you like her already."

Adrian's gaze shifted away.

He did not respond.

Sophia glanced back at Anna.

She lowered her voice. "It's perfect she's joining us for dinner."

"I saw her expression just now. She was definitely jealous."

"Let me test her feelings for you. What do you think?"

She was confident in understanding a woman's heart.

When she said she didn't mind.

She clearly saw the subtle change on Anna's face.

"No need."

Adrian refused in a deep voice.

He pulled open the car door.

His eyes swept over Anna.

Then he got into the car.

Hearing about testing Anna's feelings.

A faint thread of anticipation stirred within him.

But fear accompanied it.

He rubbed his temples.

Coldly instructing the driver to start the car.

Sophia saw his complex expression.

She already had a plan in mind.

At the restaurant.

Adrian chose a seat and sat down.

Sophia immediately sat close beside him.

She looked at Anna and said generously, "Don't stand on ceremony. Make yourself comfortable."

Anna felt like an extra person.

She forced herself to sit opposite them.

Watching her calm face.

Adrian felt inexplicably irritated.

He looked away.

The waiter quickly served all the dishes.

"Please enjoy your meal."

Sophia placed food in Adrian's bowl.

She said thoughtfully, "Eat more. You've gotten so thin from being too busy with work."

Adrian glanced at Anna.

He lowered his head and began to eat.

Sophia looked at Anna again.

She said with a clever smile, "Sorry, I just feel bad for him."

"Even when he's on a date with me, he's always busy with work."

"It's rare to have a meal out, so I couldn't help myself. Please forgive me."

She picked up a napkin and wiped the corner of his mouth.

The gesture was very intimate.

Anna's eating movements halted.

On a date with her?

She looked up at Adrian.

A sense of loss washed over her.

Had he become like this now?

Able to casually have multiple women.

Having any type of woman he wanted.

She laughed coldly inside.

Men really do change when they get money.

He was no longer the Adrian Sinclair from before.

Adrian pretended to glance up casually.

Looking at her across the table.

Then he lowered his head and continued eating.

A long time passed without any reaction from her.

He actually felt somewhat sad inside...
###Chapter 67

Anna Ross offered a faint smile.

"It's fine."

Her voice was soft.

Sophia Roscente didn't need to worry about her.

She was just the Executive Assistant Adrian Sinclair had forced to come along.

What opinion could she possibly have?

Yet her heart felt heavy, like a stone was lodged inside.

A dense, uncomfortable weight.

All she wanted now was to leave.

Surprise flickered in Sophia's eyes.

She glanced furtively at Adrian Sinclair.

He appeared even calmer than Anna.

Sophia decided to turn up the heat.

She gave a playful, charming laugh.

"That's good then."

She suddenly turned her head.

She planted a kiss on Adrian's cheek.

She smiled like a cat that got the cream.

Anna's expression froze.

She hadn't expected Sophia to be so direct.

Adrian's face darkened instantly.

He shot a look at Sophia.

His eyes held a clear warning.

Sophia stuck out her tongue.

She lowered her head to eat.

But her peripheral vision remained fixed on Anna.

Adrian also looked at Anna.

Her face was completely unreadable.

A sharp pang pierced his chest.

Did she really not care at all?

Another woman had just kissed him.

And it meant nothing to her?

Rage surged within him.

His fingers clenched tightly around his fork and knife.

His knuckles turned white.

Sophia served him some food.

She leaned in and whispered close to his ear.

She covered her mouth with a light, tinkling laugh.

Adrian glanced at Anna.

She seemed visibly uncomfortable.

A smirk suddenly tugged at his lips.

He also leaned close to Sophia's ear to speak.

Sophia giggled playfully and hit his shoulder.

"You're awful!"

"There are other people here!"

They both looked at Anna simultaneously.

Their gazes seemed to say she was the third wheel.

Anna felt like she was sitting on pins and needles.

She put down her fork and knife.

"Excuse me."

"I got some grease on my clothes."

"I need to go clean it."

She stood up and left the table.

Her retreating figure was hurried.

Sophia immediately looked at Adrian.

"Cousin, just give it up."

"She doesn't like you."

Adrian's face grew even colder.

He put down his fork and knife with a heavy thud.

"I told you not to cause trouble."

Sophia was indignant.

"What does that have to do with me?"

"You like her."

"But she feels nothing for you."

"You're just embarrassed your pride got hurt."

The air suddenly went quiet.

Only the sound of footsteps from the surrounding area remained.

Adrian stood up.

"I'm going to the restroom."

He left with a cold expression.

Sophia watched his retreating back.

She muttered under her breath.

"Got his ego bruised and now he's sulking."

"It's rare for a woman to reject him."

"This should be interesting to watch."

Anna was lost in thought in the restroom.

She didn't want to go back and watch their intimate display.

Her brow was furrowed tightly.

She finally let out a sigh.

Hiding away forever wasn't a solution.

She turned and walked out of the restroom.

Only to run straight into Adrian Sinclair.

He was walking toward her, his face completely blank.

Anna's heart leaped into her throat.

She met his gaze for a few seconds.

Then she hurriedly looked down.
###Chapter 68

Anna Ross intended to walk past as if she hadn't seen him.

The moment they brushed shoulders, Adrian Sinclair suddenly reached out and grabbed her.

Anna forcefully shook off his hand.

She looked up, meeting his gaze directly. "Will you let me leave work now?"

She had already witnessed the entire spectacle.

He shouldn't have any reason to keep her any longer.

Adrian stared at her with a dark, gloomy eyes.

The fire inside him hadn't subsided.

She dared to make demands?

"I said no," he stated, his tone leaving no room for argument.

Anna couldn't help but let out a cold laugh. "You specifically called me here to watch you and your new flame be affectionate. Is that kind of show entertaining? Or is this just your true nature? I truly feel sorry for Miss Valentine!"

Whether it was anger or impulse, she shouted everything that had been bottled up inside.

Adrian, however, seemed to hear something pleasing.

He took a step forward, a hint of a smile actually appearing in the depths of his eyes. "What's this? Are you jealous, seeing me with someone else?"

Anna's face instantly turned pale.

His expression now frightened her.

She was afraid he would treat her the way he had before.

She hastily took a step back, explaining in a low voice, "You've misunderstood. I just think it's unfair to Miss Valentine. I'm leaving."

With that, she turned and ran, leaving only a panicked shadow behind her.

Adrian stood in place, watching her leave.

Something in his cold, deep eyes seemed to melt.

He walked into the restroom and looked at his reflection in the mirror.

Only then did he realize he was actually smiling.

He immediately restrained the smile.

When he looked up again, his usual coldness had returned.

Anna ran all the way, glancing back over her shoulder frequently.

Only when she confirmed he wasn't following did she finally relax.

She secretly regretted her earlier outburst.

In her eyes, Adrian was like a dangerous wolf.

Ready to pounce and tear her apart at any moment.

She had to maintain her distance at all times.

Returning to her seat, Sophia Roscente looked up and smiled at her. "Is your outfit okay now, Miss Ross?"

Anna was momentarily stunned before she remembered.

She hadn't actually gotten anything on her clothes.

She had just made an excuse to leave, not wanting to watch their public display of affection.

She returned the smile. "It's fine, thank you."

The two sat in silence for a moment.

Anna secretly observed Sophia.

She was the cute type, her style and momentum radiating liveliness.

But she looked very young.

Anna felt a wave of confusion.

Did Adrian prefer dating younger women now?

Hesitating for a moment, she couldn't help but ask, "Miss Roscente, may I ask how old you are?"

"I just turned twenty. Why?" Sophia's frank reply surprised her.

"Nothing, I just think you're very cute," Anna said.

The other girl chuckled. "Can't help it. I have a baby face. People often mistake me for a middle schooler!"

Anna, however, couldn't bring herself to laugh.

She took a sip of water and said softly, "Do you really think Adrian is suitable? He seems to have a fiancée."
###Chapter 69

"It's alright, I don't mind."

Sophia Roscente blinked her round eyes, her smile sweet.

"Having him by my side now is enough."

Anna Ross sighed quietly.

Such a bright girl, yet she had to meet Adrian Sinclair.

"What about you?"

"You and Adrian... it doesn't seem like a normal boss-employee relationship."

"Do you like him?"

Anna choked violently, coughing uncontrollably.

Sophia quickly patted her back.

She set down her glass, her tone light.

"I'm just his Executive Assistant."

"Beyond that, there's nothing between us."

"Please don't joke about such things, Miss Roscente."

A bitter feeling stirred in her heart.

Why did it still affect her when it was already over?

Sophia tilted her head, her eyes sly.

She didn't believe these two had no connection.

"But the way he looks at you is clearly different—"

"Sophia Roscente!"

A cold male voice cut her off abruptly.

Adrian Sinclair stood by the table, his gaze sharp as a blade.

Sophia immediately looked down, pretending to focus on her meal.

Adrian's eyes fell on Anna.

"You can clock out now."

His voice was icy. "Stop being an eyesore here."

Anna gripped her bag strap tightly, standing up to leave.

Her departure was swift, without a hint of reluctance.

Sophia watched her go, sighing inwardly.

What on earth did her cousin do...

To make that girl avoid him so quickly?

She picked up a piece of meat, trying to lighten the mood.

Adrian shot her a cold look. "She's gone. No need to act."

Sophia huffily put the meat back, muttering.

"So ungrateful!"
###Chapter 70

Adrian Sinclair glanced at her briefly without a word.

His gaze swept over the spot where Anna Ross had been sitting moments before, pensive.

Sophia Roscente took a few bites before another thought struck her.

She leaned in with a gossipy grin, curiosity sparkling in her eyes. "Cousin, I remember you were a complete wreck after that breakup. Moping around, drowning yourself in alcohol for ages."

She recalled clearly how he'd lock himself away, refusing to see anyone, or stumble home drunk late at night, muttering 'why' over and over. The whole family was worried sick, but nothing they did helped.

Adrian's expression darkened instantly.

Sophia felt the air around them freeze, a chill running down her spine.

"Stay out of it if you want to stay here," he warned coldly. "Or I'll call your mother right now and have a nice long chat about you."

Sophia panicked immediately.

She whined about him always resorting to threats while begging, "I'm sorry, cousin! I promise I'll keep my mouth shut! Please don't tell Mom! I snuck out—if she finds out, I'm dead! You wouldn't let your adorable cousin suffer, would you?"

"You think I didn't know you sneaked back?"

Adrian shot her a look, taking a slow sip of water.

The noise was giving him a headache. He just wanted to send her away as soon as possible.

Sophia pouted, feeling wronged.

She glared at her aloof cousin and muttered under her breath, "Life abroad is so boring. It's much better here. Everything's more fun." She quickly added some flattery, "And most importantly, I get to see my handsome cousin!"

Adrian looked disgusted and told her to shut up.

"So what's your plan now? You know what will happen if your mother finds out you sneaked back, right?"

Sophia deflated instantly.

She sighed deeply. With her mother's fiery temper, she'd probably break her legs just for this!

The thought made even the delicious food in front of her lose its appeal.

She shook her head. "I'll just take it one step at a time. Keep it hidden for now!"

Adrian glanced at her but didn't comment.

Sophia, however, saw an opportunity.

She immediately put on a pitiful face and pleaded, "Cousin, please take your poor little cousin in! Otherwise, I won't even have a place to stay in San Francisco!"

Seeing her act cute gave Adrian goosebumps.

He held up a hand to keep her at a distance. "Stop. I don't need extra baggage."

With that, he stood up and headed toward the hotel.

Sophia stomped her foot in frustration.

Afraid he would really abandon her, she hurried after him, shouting, "Cousin! Wait for me!"
###Chapter 71

The car came to a stop.

Anna Ross pushed the door open and got out.

She walked quickly into her apartment.

She locked the door behind her.

Only then did she allow herself to relax.

She lay down on the bed.

The image of Adrian Sinclair confronting the client surfaced.

He had shielded her.

It was exactly like before.

Back then, he always protected her.

He never let her get hurt.

But.

Everything had changed.

He had said he hated her.

If not for her position as his Executive Assistant.

He probably would have just watched coldly.

But seeing him interact so closely with Sophia Roscente.

Her heart still felt heavy and uncomfortable.

A wave of bitterness washed over her.

She despised this part of herself.

She was like a ridiculous fool.

He clearly didn't care.

Yet here she was, lost in her own delusions.

She shook her head and sat up.

She stared at her reflection.

Anna Ross, stop these foolish thoughts.

It was doomed from the day you broke up.

Now he is him, and you are you.

There is nothing between you except work.

After this self-affirmation.

She felt a little lighter.

Her phone suddenly rang.

She picked it up.

Seeing it was her mother calling.

She answered immediately.

Her voice filled with joy.

Mom!

There was a moment of silence on the other end.

Then Howard Lowell's rough voice came through.
Are you off work?
Come back. Now.

Hearing his voice.
Anna's face instantly turned cold.
She didn't speak.

Howard's voice was icy.
What, not willing?

Her face paled.
Where's Mom?
Why do you have her phone?

Where is my mother!?

Howard snorted coldly.
If you want to see her, get back here.

Ever since she witnessed her mother being beaten last time.
She knew her mother was in constant danger.
If he dared to abuse her mother again.
She would not stand by and do nothing.

She kept looking ahead.

Miss, this is as fast as I can go.
Any faster and we'll have an accident.

But safety was most important.

She desperately wished for news that her mother was safe.
But there was nothing.

Anna jumped out quickly.
She ran toward her house.
###Chapter 72

The wind howled in her ears.

Yet Anna Ross's heart beat even faster.

Stepping into the house.

Her tension finally eased slightly.

Vivian Lowell rose immediately at the sound.

She hurried forward and took her daughter's hand.

Joy radiated from her face.
"Anna, you're back."

She quickly noticed something was off about Anna.

"How did you get so exhausted?

"I'm fine, don't worry.

Seeing her mother truly wasn't hurt.

Just as she wiped her mouth to speak.

"I know, Mom, don't worry.

"What has Adrian Sinclair been up to lately?"

Should she really tell him everything?

Seeing her strange expression and silence.

"What? Don't care about your mother anymore?"

But it only earned a scornful laugh.

She was too weak to protect her mother.

No need to worry about the engagement with the Valentine family."

"Another girl?"
Howard crossed his arms, scrutinizing her.

"Which family's daughter is she?"

He suspected Adrian had connected with another powerful family.

His look toward Anna grew even more disdainful.
"All this time, and you still haven't secured him."

Anna frowned.

She truly didn't know the identity.
She could only shake her head and say flatly.
"I don't know her background.
I only know her name is Sophia Roscente."
###Chapter 73

Howard Lowell’s face darkened instantly at the mention of Sophia Roscente’s name.

He shot to his feet, jabbing a finger toward Anna Ross.

“You’re utterly hopeless!”

His chest heaved with ragged breaths.

Anna was baffled by his outburst.

She couldn’t understand what she had done wrong.

“I followed your instructions to monitor Adrian Sinclair. I reported everything exactly as it happened.”

Howard let out a cold, angry laugh.

“Sophia Roscente isn’t Adrian’s girlfriend. She’s his cousin!”

Anna froze.

She suddenly remembered the Lowell family had two daughters.

Adrian’s mother was the eldest, and Sophia’s mother was the younger one.

No wonder Adrian never resisted Sophia’s affectionate gestures.

They were family all along.

She had misunderstood him…

The realization brought an unexpected sense of relief.

But she quickly shook her head.

She was just happy for Chloe Valentine.

Adrian hadn’t betrayed her feelings.

“I’ll let it slide this time. You’re not familiar with their family.”

Howard massaged his temples, his expression softening slightly.

“But the mission continues. You must keep a close watch on Adrian. No more mistakes.”

His voice turned icy.

“Otherwise, I can’t guarantee your mother’s safety.”

Anna’s fingers clenched tightly.

She suppressed the urge to flee with her mother.

“I understand.”

Howard nodded in satisfaction.

He propped his feet on the desk, his face grim.

“There’s some trouble at the branch office. I need to handle it.”

“Your task is to bring Adrian back to New York. By any means necessary.”

Anna looked up in shock.

“How is that possible?”

She couldn’t possibly influence Adrian’s decisions.

Howard overestimated her.

More importantly, her mother was still in San Francisco.

She couldn’t leave her side.

Howard’s eyes turned cold.

“You refuse?”

Anna forced herself to stay calm.

“It’s not that I refuse. It’s impossible. Adrian won’t listen to me.”

Howard sneered.

He turned and pulled a file from the bookshelf.

Anna’s heart jumped at the sound.

“Take a good look at these documents.”

He settled back into his chair, watching her with a cold gaze.

“Then tell me your decision.”
###Chapter 74

Anna Ross walked to the desk.

She picked up the documents.

The papers trembled slightly between her fingers.

When she saw the contents.

Her vision went dark.

The black and white records were crystal clear.

Each entry was a transfer from Howard Lowell to her mother.

The smallest amount was three million.

The largest even exceeded ten million.

Anna gripped the edge of the desk.

Her fingertips turned white from the pressure.

She desperately flipped through each page.

The numbers were staggering.

So this was the "unavoidable circumstance" her mother mentioned.

Such an astronomical debt.

Howard watched coldly.

A mocking smile played on his lips.

"Seen enough?"

"All of this is what you and your mother owe me."

"Be obedient."

"Otherwise, if these evidences are sent out."

"Your mother will spend the rest of her life in prison."

Anna's heart sank to the bottom.

She had naively believed she could repay it.

Now it seemed like a complete joke.

Howard added leisurely.

"If you don't want her in jail."

"Do as I say."

"I'll keep these things safe."

"Quite a fair trade, isn't it?"

Fair.

Anna sneered inwardly.

Her freedom had never been in her own hands.

Bitterness welled up in her heart.

But now was not the time for sorrow.

She had to protect her mother.

Anna put down the papers.

Her voice was calm and steady.

"I agree."

"I hope you keep your promise."

Howard snorted lightly.

He put the documents back into the bag.

He wasn't worried about her resistance.

Controlling this mother and daughter was effortless for him.

"May I go now?"

He studied her face.

"Your face is indeed beautiful."

"No wonder Adrian Sinclair is captivated."

Anna turned her face away.

She didn't want to hear such nonsense.

Howard stepped closer.

He lowered his voice.

"If you can be with Adrian Sinclair."

"I can wipe out all these debts."

Anna's expression froze.

"I'll remember that."

She walked around Howard and hurried downstairs.

Her mind was in turmoil.

Be with Adrian Sinclair.

Only he could say such a thing.

How Adrian treated her now.

She knew better than anyone.

There was no possibility between them anymore.
###Chapter 75

Uncle Nie quickly approached Adrian Sinclair.

He whispered a few words in a low voice.

Adrian's gaze turned icy cold.

His sharp eyes swept toward Cherry Lin like a blade.

Cherry was still weeping and confessing.

"The two children were right in front of me, but I couldn't stop it in time..."

"It's all my fault! When I saw those online attacks against Anna later, my heart broke with guilt."

Cherry spoke until her own eyes turned red.

Then she heard Adrian's cold voice. "Uncle Nie, see our guest out."

Cherry, lost in her self-pity, froze in shock.

Her eyes widened in disbelief.

See her out?

How could this be? She had acted so vulnerable and kind. Shouldn't they be comforting her?

Uncle Nie made a gesture with an expressionless face. "This way, please."

Cherry stood up uneasily.

She looked at Adrian pitifully, biting her lip. "Mr. Sinclair, did I say something wrong?"

So it was true. They got angry as soon as she mentioned failing to protect Anna.

They were blaming her.

They were the ones who made the principal fire her.

Grandma Sinclair's face was stern. "You didn't say anything wrong. We were wrong to let you in."

Before Cherry could react, Uncle Nie firmly escorted her out of the living room.

Anna looked confusedly at her uncle, then at her grandma.

What had happened?

She had just finished listening to Master's story about Mary Sue, and now Teacher Cherry was leaving?

She hadn't even caught the Playboy Ghost yet!

Master Ji floated mid-air. "Next time. Not here. It's bad energy."

The little girl instinctively waved. "Goodbye, Teacher Cherry..."

Merlin lifted Anna onto his shoulders. "Come on, Dad will take you to your room."

Anna was suddenly high up and let out a surprised "Ah!"

Then she laughed happily.

This was her first time riding a giant horse!

So high!

It felt like she could reach the chandelier. Could she touch the moon if they were outside?

Anna shouted excitedly, "Daddy, higher! Higher!"

Merlin gently bounced his shoulders.

Anna squealed with delight, even happier.

Grandma Sinclair worriedly cautioned, "Be careful! Don't drop her!"

Merlin was full of confidence. "It's fine. I could carry a plane and run. Carrying her is nothing. I won't drop her."

Grandma Sinclair watched the father-daughter pair speechlessly.

Anna excitedly listed, "I'll pick stars for Grandma, for Grandpa, for Uncle Adrian, Uncle Two, Uncle Five, Little Uncle... and for brothers and sisters..."

"Then for Daddy, for Little Five, for Grandpa Turtle..."

She named everyone in the family, even the pets.

Merlin's lips curved up.

He held her small hand and raised it high.

The father and daughter laughed and played their way upstairs.

Suddenly, there was a loud thud.

Anna covered her forehead. "Waaah! I hit the doorframe too!"

Merlin quickly checked. "How? I already bent down..."

Anna pouted. "Not low enough! Just a little bit lower!"

Merlin guiltily rubbed her forehead. "Mmm, Daddy's fault."

The Sinclair family didn't know whether to laugh or be angry.

This unreliable dad only knew how to mess things up for his kid!

Grandma Sinclair muttered as she hurried to get the first aid kit.

**

Cherry Lin stood outside the closed iron gate.

Tears streamed down her face uncontrollably.

She whispered grievancely, "What did I even do wrong?"

She had genuinely come to apologize.

Why wouldn't the Sinclair family listen to her explanation...

Cherry felt both wronged and humiliated.

But mostly, she felt heartbroken.

Heartbroken that five excellent men didn't believe her.

An image appeared in her mind: In a princess's castle, five men who deeply loved her all left angrily because of a misunderstanding... The princess cried sadly, and a cherry blossom rain fell from the sky... The princess ran out and slipped...

Cherry blossom petals fell one after another, landing on her eyelashes that were like butterfly wings. The five knights hurried back, but the princess refused to open her eyes again. They were filled with regret...

Wuwu, so tragic. Cherry cried even harder, sobbing all the way home.

Zhou Xiao was waiting anxiously.

Seeing her return in tears, he immediately pulled her into his embrace.

"What's wrong? You didn't answer my calls!"

Cherry sobbed uncontrollably in his arms. "Brother Zhou Xiao... Did I really do something wrong? But I really didn't mean to..."

"Why did the principal fire me? Why won't the Sinclair family forgive me..."

Cherry cried loudly.

Zhou Xiao comforted her. "It's not your fault. It's not your fault. Be good, don't cry..."

Cherry cried for a while.

Then she suddenly saw her own tear-streaked face in the full-length mirror.

But Zhou Xiao, who was holding her, seemed so ordinary.

She used to think he was sunny and handsome, the best among her several boyfriends.

But after meeting Adrian and Merlin, Cherry felt he wasn't good enough for her.

Suddenly feeling bored, Cherry stopped crying.

An indescribable discomfort rose in her heart. A good girl like her should be comforted in the arms of someone like Adrian or Merlin.

Cherry pushed Zhou Xiao away abruptly and ran out.

Zhou Xiao stood frozen. "???"

"Little Cherry!" He hurriedly chased after her.

The hallway was already empty.

Zhou Xiao frantically pressed the elevator button, anxiously running downstairs.

After he left, the lights in the dark stairwell turned on.

A figure stood there...

It was Cherry.

She covered her mouth and whispered painfully, "I'm sorry, Brother Zhou Xiao. We can never be together again. Fate let us meet, but we cannot be together... Wuwu."

Heartbroken, Cherry... went to Yi Bin's house.

Yi Bin was both surprised and delighted. "Little Cherry, why are you here?"

Cherry thought she looked "haggard" as she glanced at Yi Bin.

She realized he was even less worthy of her.

She immediately burst into loud sobs.

But it was late.

She decided to finish crying tonight and leave tomorrow.

She and him were destined to have no future... Wuwu!

**

In Anna's room.

Merlin reached out. "Let me do it."

It was unacceptable to let the elderly take care of the child so late...

Grandma Sinclair glared at him. "You be quiet!"

Grandma Sinclair: "You be quiet too!"

###Chapter 76

"Mhm." A cool reply came from the other end of the line.

###Chapter 77

The thought of staying by Adrian Sinclair's side while also trying to persuade him to return to New York gave Anna Ross a headache.

"You!?"

Feisty? What kind of description was that?

He looked at Anna, his gaze meaningful.

Oh no, he's getting the wrong idea again.

Losing face like this in front of Adrian was social suicide.

Adrian's lips curved slightly, a faint smile playing on them.
The man waved a hand. "Forget it. I'm too much of a gentleman to fight with a lady. Let me introduce myself—Marcus Hill, Adrian's childhood friend."

Anna was secretly shocked.
So he was Adrian's friend!

Adrian's gaze shifted to Anna on the sofa.

Anna's heart lifted.
They were having a friends' meal—surely he'd let her go now?

###Chapter 78

This way she could complete Howard Lowell's task.

And she could see her best friend.
###Chapter 79

Did she actually want to stay by his side?

So gentle with the girl.

So cold with his bro.

......

Based on his understanding of Adrian, it definitely wasn't just an executive assistant.

"My family forced an arranged marriage on me. But I don't want that kind of relationship."
###Chapter 80

The person he loves?

He instantly thought of Anna Ross.

No wonder Adrian was so unusually attentive to that girl. So he had feelings for her.

If Adrian really got involved in his marriage plans, there would be no escape.

。。。。。。。。

###Chapter 81

###Chapter 83

###Chapter 84

###Chapter 85

"Don't be afraid."

Her smile was as radiant as sunlight.

"Anytime."

"Just call me when you want to eat."

He was bored alone anyway.

Having a lively little sister around was nice.

"Pinky promise!"

Her eyes sparkled.

"No take-backs!"

Marcus found it a bit childish.

But he hooked his finger with hers anyway.

"No take-backs."

"Time to head back."

He remembered Adrian Sinclair's warning.

He couldn't keep his cousin out too late.

"Let's go back to the hotel."

The night sky over New York was stained crimson by neon lights.

Anna Ross leaned against the car window.

She watched the bustling scene outside.

Skyscrapers stood tall.

Shopping malls were brightly lit.

Pedestrians hurried along.

A soft melody drifted from a tea house.

The entire city was a blend of hustle and romance.

This was New York.

The city of countless dreams.

Chloe Valentine suddenly let out a light laugh.

"Is this your first time in New York, Executive Assistant Ross?"

Her tone carried a hint of mockery.

The car window slowly rose.

It shut out the noise of the city outside.
###Chapter 96

The Bay Area?
Anna repeated the name silently. It sounded expensive.

Her phone ringtone interrupted her thoughts. It was a call from Mia Lawrence.

Anna got out with her suitcase.

"Okay!" Anna was rarely this happy.
The two walked into the restaurant laughing and talking.
###Chapter 97

This would help tide them over.

"Men like that are the worst."

"He's clearly toying with you."

One second she was saying he treated her well.
Her mood swings were astonishingly fast.

"Don't worry."

"I'm very clear-headed."

"You can't stay by his side any longer."

"Nothing else will happen."

###Chapter 98

Anna Ross froze for a moment.

After dinner.

The moment the door opened.

The kitchen.

The living room.

The bathroom.

The bedroom.

Every corner was decorated in her favorite style.

He had even prepared a study for her.

Holding the book.

To pay the rent.

The money he earned always went to little gifts for her.

Every time she came home after class.

The small surprises he prepared would move her to tears.

Then he would gently hold her in his arms.

And softly wipe away her tears.

Those memories felt so distant, like they happened in a past life.

In this life.

She no longer deserved such pure love and happiness.

Mia excitedly explored every room.

She bounced over to Anna.

"Rich people are something else. This is totally my dream home!"

"Anna, I'm sleeping over with you tonight!"

The astronomical bill Howard Lowell had shown her.

Lingered in her mind.

A constant unease hung over her heart.

She asked softly.

"What's wrong? Is something bothering you?"

The city remained bustling as ever.

Late at night, the sound of traffic and lively voices still came from outside the window.

Every sound was crystal clear.

Anna had never been so urgent about making money before.

###Chapter 99

Mia Lawrence let out a sigh of relief.

Anna Ross's eyes lit up.

As long as there was a source of income, it would be worth it no matter how tired she got.

The decision to leave San Francisco had filled her with courage.

Now she just wanted to save enough money quickly to take her mother away.

As Anna's best friend, she had witnessed the other's most difficult times.

There were more opportunities in New York than in San Francisco.

She could work several jobs at the same time.

Being a little more tired didn't matter.

Listening to her friend's even breathing, Anna felt warmth in her heart. It felt so good to have someone to confide in and rely on. Having such a friend was how she had managed to endure until now.

She still had work tomorrow, so she didn't dare stay up late. She gently pulled up the covers.

At the same time, in the most bustling area of New York.

A black Maybach stopped in front of a retro-style villa.

Adrian Sinclair stepped out of the car.

"Young Master, the old master has been waiting for you for a long time."

"Grandpa."

"You're finally here. Have you eaten?"

"I've eaten."

"Let's wait a bit longer. I want to get to know her better." The words almost spilled out of Adrian's mouth. Whenever marriage was mentioned, he would always think of Anna's disappointed expression.

"You've always had your own ideas. We'll do it your way."
###Chapter 100

Grandpa Frederick had dominated the business world for decades.

For Adrian Sinclair to gain a firm foothold in this cutthroat circle.

An arranged marriage was an indispensable part.

But the things he desired.

Amid the curling tea fragrance.

He recalled those shocking accounts.

That useless son of his.

Henry hurried forward to support him.

Early the next morning.

Anna Ross turned over.

Wanting to continue sleeping.

Mia Lawrence mumbled drowsily.

"Anna, sleep a little longer..."

She knew who it was without looking.

Who else would be so urgently demanding this early.

Other than Adrian Sinclair.

"Get up. Time for work."

Work, work.

Always pushing her to work.

Even workhorses weren't driven this hard.

###Chapter 101

Anna hurried downstairs.

###Chapter 103

Meticulous, icy, and impermeable.

Grandpa suddenly bringing someone to the company.

Eager to replace that Executive Assistant immediately.

He looked down, absently stroking his platinum signet ring.

Chloe's inner voice screamed.

This man would be hers.
###Chapter 108

Adrian Sinclair's voice cut through the air, cold and sharp.

"You were there when Grandpa ran into Anna Ross today?"

Chloe Valentine's heart tightened.

She recalled the old man's words from earlier.

She quickly softened her tone to explain.

"Yes."

"We had just arrived at the company."

"We met at the elevator bank."

"We just exchanged a simple greeting."

Adrian lifted his gaze.

His sharp eyes locked onto her.

"Is that so."

"Did you introduce her to Grandpa?"

Chloe's heart sank.

Grandpa had made it clear he didn't like Anna.

Adrian must suspect she said something.

His presence was overwhelming.

She found it hard to even breathe.

But then she remembered.

She was his fiancée.

The sweet words might smooth things over.

"Adrian."

"It really was a coincidence."

"If you don't believe me, you can ask Noah."

A cold smirk flickered in Adrian's eyes.

He had asked if she had spoken out of turn in front of Grandpa.

Yet she kept avoiding the point.

Only emphasizing the chance meeting.

He saw right through her little game.

Watching her nervousness, Adrian suddenly curved his lips.

"No need to be so tense."

"I was just asking casually."

His demeanor was too relaxed.

Chloe felt a sense of controlled fear.

But as long as he didn't expose her, there was still room to maneuver.

She forced a sweet smile.

"I just like you too much."

"That's why I get nervous around you."

"They say it's a sign a girl is really smitten."

She walked to his desk.

Deliberately leaning forward.

Her V-neck dress was already low-cut.

The movement left little to the imagination.

Her voice grew even more delicate.

"Adrian."

"Don't you think I'm right?"

Adrian indifferently looked away.

His tone flat.

"She and I only have a professional relationship."

"Nothing more."

"I hope you can understand."

He stood and walked to the floor-to-ceiling window.

Turning his back to her.

He had dismissed the topic so lightly.

Chloe felt stifled.

But she could only play the understanding role.

"I know."

Understand?

His emphasis was clearly meant to protect Anna.

She wasn't a fool.

How could she not see it.

Adrian messaged for Anna Ross.

He gave instructions right in front of Chloe.

"Your new workstation."

"Will be right outside my office."

Anna sensed the subtly atmosphere.

But she didn't dare ask questions.

She immediately agreed.

"Understood, Mr. Sinclair."

She just wanted to obey quietly.

To avoid angering him.

Hearing this arrangement, Chloe's blood boiled.

He was placing her right outside his office.

So close to him.

While she was sent to the distant Creative Department.

Why?

She glared at Anna with resentment.

But as long as Anna remained in the company.

She would have plenty of chances to reclaim that position.

She walked up to Anna.

Extending her hand with a sweet smile.

"Executive Assistant Ross."

"From now on, we must work hard together."

"And share Adrian's burdens properly."
###Chapter 109

Anna Ross stared at the well-manicured hand.

Though she couldn't hear the conversation inside the office.

Chloe Valentine's oppressive aura was unmistakable.

Anna maintained a polite smile.

She returned the handshake lightly.

"I'll focus on my responsibilities."

Adrian Sinclair leaned against the floor-to-ceiling window.

His brow twitched almost imperceptibly.

His gaze drifted over her.

Chloe caught his glance.

Her perfectly made-up face tightened briefly.

She quickly resumed her gracious smile.

"Grandpa insisted on arranging my position personally."

"We'll be colleagues now."

She emphasized "Grandpa" pointedly.

Each syllable dripped with territorial claim.

Anna lowered her eyes.

These implications meant nothing to her.

Adrian abruptly interrupted.

"Time to get to work."

Chloe immediately latched onto his arm.

"Adrian."

"I don't know where the Creative Department is."

"Could you walk me there?"

She pressed herself against him.

Adrian frowned.

Out of respect for his grandfather, he didn't push her away.

He nodded agreement.

His eyes shifted past Chloe to Anna.

Anna quickly looked away.

Noah Watson entered at that moment.

Anna hurried over to discuss work details.

Noah glanced confusedly at the tense trio.

Adrian led Chloe away.

As they passed, Chloe shot Anna a triumphant look.

Noah handed over a stack of files.

"These are the prep materials for your tasks."

"Please review them first."

Anna was surprised.

"Thank you."

Noah gave brief instructions before leaving hastily.

Anna returned to her workstation.

It faced Adrian's office directly.

She could see people moving in the hallway.

But it didn't distract from reading documents.

She didn't even notice when Adrian returned.

He paused briefly at his door.

Then entered his office.

......

Quitting time arrived.

Colleagues left chatting and laughing.

Anna sighed at her computer screen.

She mentally chastised Adrian.

Her phone rang suddenly.

"Mia?"

"Anna, are you off work yet?"

Anna couldn't help complaining.

"I should be."

"But that taskmaster Adrian—"

The office door swung open.

Adrian stood there with a dark expression.

Anna's breath caught.

When had he returned?

Had he heard everything?

She wished she could vanish instantly.
###Chapter 110

Anna Ross quickly straightened her posture.

It was already after work hours.

Why couldn't she leave?

She cleared her throat and asked softly, "Um... when can I clock out?"

Adrian Sinclair noticed every little movement she made.

Weren't you quite bold when complaining about me earlier?

Now you're scared?

"You can leave now," he said indifferently.

He then turned and entered his office.

He didn't spare her another glance.

Anna stood frozen in place.

He was being unusually agreeable today?

She quickly remembered.

He was taking Chloe Valentine to see Grandpa later.

She, an outsider, naturally had no reason to tag along.

A strange pang of pain shot through her heart.

But being able to leave work was always good.

She took a taxi to where Mia Lawrence worked.

Mia had continued working in real estate sales after moving to New York.

She heard the pay was better here than in San Francisco.

Plus, she was about to get a promotion soon.

Anna stood outside the real estate office and made a call.

"Mia, I'm downstairs at your company."

"Are you off work yet?"

Mia ran out excitedly.

Anna smiled. "I'm in a good mood today."

"How about I treat you to dinner?"

"Great!" Mia linked arms with her.

"I'm starving!"

After they finished eating.

Mia suddenly remembered something.

"Anna, about that job you asked me to keep an eye out for."

"I found a few pretty good ones."

"Want to go check them out now?"

Anna nodded immediately.

"Let's go now."

She hadn't expected her friend to be so efficient.

They arrived at a bar called Moonlight Lounge.

Anna hesitated slightly.

But for the sake of earning money, she went in.

The music inside the bar was deafening.

The owner happened to be at the front desk.

His eyes lit up when he saw two pretty girls.

"Here to have fun or looking for work?"

Anna mustered her courage and spoke up.

"I'm here for a part-time job."

Mia added.

"We contacted earlier about the drink promotion position."

The owner instantly got excited.

"Of course!"

He clapped his hands.

Someone brought over a bunny girl costume.

Anna and Mia's eyes widened.

They grabbed each other's hands and ran out.

They only stopped after running quite a distance.

Catching her breath, Anna shook her head.

"I really can't do this one."

Mia was also still shaken.

"Let's look at some others."

They checked out a few more places.

None of them satisfied Anna.

"This is the last one."

Mia pointed at the bar in front of them.

"They need a resident singer here."

"You won awards for singing in college."

Anna smiled bitterly.

She did love singing.

She once dreamed of becoming a singer.

But because of her mother, she couldn't continue her studies.
###Chapter 111

"Let's go inside and check."

If this bar didn't work out, she would have to give up on finding a part-time job.

Dreamland Bar was far better than the previous places they had visited.

The owner was a woman in her thirties, sharp and efficient.

She warmly greeted them as they entered. "Welcome."

She looked at the two girls with slight surprise. "Are you here for the job?"

Mia Lawrence spoke first. "We spoke on the phone. My friend wants to apply for the performer position."

The owner understood and turned to Anna Ross. "Sing a few lines for me."

Anna chose a familiar song and softly sang a verse.

The owner's eyes lit up with admiration. She couldn't help but applaud. "Excellent!"
