Anna and Mia exchanged glances, nodding in pleasant surprise.

"I can do it."

The owner said cheerfully, "You can start tomorrow or the day after. Just contact me then."

They exchanged contact information before leaving.

Mia went home first due to her period. Anna returned to her room alone.

She collapsed onto the bed. Images of Adrian Sinclair and Chloe Valentine dining together suddenly flooded her mind.

Their marriage seemed inevitable. They would probably wed soon.

She sat up abruptly.

The memory of Grandpa Lowell's affectionate demeanor toward Chloe that morning remained vivid.

Would Adrian come to love her that way too?

"Anna Ross, these thoughts are not for you."

She shook her head, grabbed her clothes, and walked into the bathroom.

Hot water cascaded down, gradually soothing her restless heart.

She was drying her hair, ready for bed, when her phone rang.

It was her mother, Vivian Lowell.

Anna realized she had forgotten to check in.

Her mother's concerned voice came through immediately. "Anna, are you doing alright over there?"

"Mom, I'm fine. Don't worry." Her nose tingled with emotion.

Vivian sighed in relief. "No news for so many days. I'm just glad you're safe."

Anna's voice choked up. "I'll work hard to earn money. I'll take you away from here someday."

Vivian responded gently. "I know. Get some rest now. You have work tomorrow."
###Chapter 112

"Alright, take good care of yourself at home."

Vivian Lowell's voice was gentle. "Mom is fine here at home. You're out there all alone. Tell me if anything happens."

Anna Ross felt her nose sting slightly.

She couldn't help but wish her mother could always be by her side, no matter where she went. How wonderful that would be.

But this wish would come true someday.

She suppressed her emotions and replied softly, "I will, Mom."

She waited quietly for the other end to hang up first.

Anna tossed her phone aside and lay down on the bed, ready to sleep.

The most important thing right now was to work hard and earn money.

Everything else, she shouldn't think about anymore.

Some things simply couldn't be changed just because she wanted them to.

Ding dong—

A message suddenly popped up on her phone.

[Adrian: Come pick me up.]

It was followed immediately by a location pin.

Anna stared at the screen, her chest tight with anger.

Did he get uncomfortable if he didn't torment her for a single day?

She really wanted to pretend she hadn't seen it.

Wait—wasn't he having dinner with Chloe Valentine? Why was he asking her to pick him up?

Had something happened?

After hesitating for a few seconds, she still got up, changed clothes, and called a car on her phone.

She quickly arrived at the restaurant Adrian had sent.

It had a classic design, elegant and tasteful, even more upscale than the last one.

Anna got out of the car and asked the driver to wait.

She was about to make a call when she spotted Adrian sitting on a bench near the entrance.

She hurried over.

Before she even got close, she caught a faint scent of alcohol.

"Why are you here alone?" she couldn't help asking.

Where were Grandpa Frederick and Chloe Valentine? How could they leave him here by himself?

Adrian looked up at her.

He stood, his tone carrying a hint of dissatisfaction. "You're too slow. Not afraid I'd freeze to death on the roadside?"

With that, he directly walked past her, pulled open the car door, and got into the taxi.

Anna stood frozen in place, gritting her teeth in anger.

It was already good enough that she came to pick him up, and he still complained?

She took a deep breath, telling herself not to get angry, and followed him into the car.

Adrian leaned back against the seat, eyes closed, looking exhausted.

Anna suddenly felt a strange pang of emotion.

He was the one who went to dinner with his fiancée, yet in the end, she was the one picking him up in the middle of the night.

She couldn't help muttering under her breath, "Has a driver but doesn't use him. Insists on making someone without a car come pick him up. Can bosses just be this willful?"

Her voice was very soft, but Adrian still heard it.

He lifted his eyelids slightly, giving her a glance, and explained flatly, "The driver went to take Chloe home."

Anna was startled.

She hadn't expected him to hear, and instantly felt flustered.

But what confused her more was, why didn't he take her home himself?

Sensing Adrian's gaze still resting on her, she quickly changed the subject. "It's getting late. I'll take you back first."

Only after saying it did she remember she had no idea where he lived.

She turned to look at him and asked hesitantly, "By the way, where do you live?"
###Chapter 113

Silence fell inside the car.

The driver secretly observed the two through the rearview mirror.

Adrian Sinclair suddenly spoke. "I want to see where you live." His deep eyes locked onto her, as if trying to pull her in.

Anna Ross's breath hitched.

Although his behavior had been proper since arriving in New York, nothing like before.

His unpredictable nature still made her fearful.

She reminded him softly. "Mr. Sinclair, it's very late."

"If you don't return soon, Grandpa will worry."

She didn't believe he would insist after bringing up his grandfather.

"He wouldn't worry about such a small matter." His breath brushed past her, carrying a faint scent of alcohol.

Anna glanced at him helplessly.

Sensing her tension, Adrian chuckled lowly.

His voice was deep and mesmerizing. "What's wrong?"

"Can't I even see the apartment I rented?"

Anna wanted to refute, but his words left her speechless.

She regretted it deeply. She never should have accepted the apartment he found.

Seeing her no longer refusing, Adrian instructed the driver. "To the Bay Area."

The driver breathed a sigh of relief and immediately started the car.

He had waited here too long, almost got desensitized.

Was it easy getting a fare in the middle of the night!

The residence wasn't far, and they arrived quickly.

Anna thanked the driver and got out.

Adrian surveyed the surrounding environment.

The security was good, which satisfied him.

This place was very suitable for her to live.

Anna watched him inspecting the area like it was work and couldn't help but purse her lips.

She stepped forward and opened the door. Before she could speak, Adrian had already slipped inside.

Anna: "......"

Even if he found the apartment, couldn't he be a little less casual?

At least he should ask her, the resident, for her opinion.

Forget it. He was always this authoritarian.

Closing the door, she followed him in.

Adrian scanned the interior, then sat down on the sofa.

He raised a hand to rub his temples.

Anna was a little curious.

He seemed to be in a bad mood tonight.

"Get me a glass of water." A muffled voice came from the sofa.

Although reluctant, Anna complied.

After he finished the water, Anna thought about hurrying him back.

She pretended to glance at the time in surprise. "It's so late. You should go back, Mr. Sinclair."

Adrian looked at her, not saying a word.

He remembered his grandfather brought him and Chloe Valentine together during dinner, and restless rose in his heart.

Anna felt a chill down her spine under his gaze and instinctively stepped back.

She never should have brought him back.

"Do you still like me?"
###Chapter 114

His words struck like lightning.

Anna Ross froze completely.

Why was he suddenly asking this?

Was he truly drunk?

She didn't want to answer.

But his gaze locked onto her, leaving no escape.

"Answer me." His voice was low, filled with pressure.

Seeing the unwillingness in his eyes, her heart ached sharply.

What right did she have to talk about likes or dislikes now?

"I stopped liking you a long time ago." She turned to flee.

Adrian Sinclair's kiss descended.

He bit her lip until it broke.

The taste of blood spread between their teeth.

A woman who only loved money.

How could she have any feelings for him?

Yet her taste was so intoxicating.

He was addicted from the first touch.

She didn't push him away.

Their body temperatures rose.

Breaths intertwined.

His hand slipped beneath her clothes.

Anna jolted back to awareness.

"No!" She grabbed his wrist.

The corners of her eyes reddened, making her look pitiful and vulnerable.

Adrian's eyes darkened further.

He gripped her wrist and kissed her again.

The kiss was urgent.

His hands roamed over her body.

Anna trembled, struggling.

It was useless.

Worse, her body was actually responding.

She cursed herself silently for being shameless.

He released her lips and carried her toward the bedroom.

Tears welled in Anna's eyes. "Adrian, you can't do this!"

She was like a lamb awaiting slaughter, powerless to resist.

He ignored her pleas.

His warm kisses trailed from her lips downward.

"Annie..." His voice was hoarse.

Anna froze.

He used to call her that.

His gaze softened, reminiscent of their university days.

She clawed his back fiercely. "Bastard!"

Surprise flickered in Adrian's eyes.

His movements became gentle.

...

The next day.

The alarm clock rang.

Anna opened her eyes wearily.

Memories of last night flooded her mind.

His scent still lingered in the room.

A faint sense of relief washed over her.

She had once promised her first time to him.

Now that promise was fulfilled.
###Chapter 115

Anna Ross turned her face away.

The man beside her was still asleep.

Morning light filtered through the curtains, falling on his sharply defined features.

It cast a soft, hazy glow.

Memories of last night crashed into her mind.

Her fingertips trembled slightly.

Clothes were scattered across the floor.

She bent down to pick them up.

She dressed herself, piece by piece.

She tried to move.

A sharp pain instantly shot through her entire body.

It felt like she had been run over.

Every bone screamed in protest.

Adrian Sinclair opened his eyes.

He pulled out his phone and answered.

"Understood."

"I'll be right there."

The bedroom was empty.

The elevator ascended slowly.

Her heart grew tighter with each floor.

Ding.

Noah Watson walked toward her.

"Good morning, Executive Assistant Ross."

Anna forced a smile.

"Morning."

"Looking for Mr. Sinclair?"

"He's out today."

"He won't be coming to the office."

Anna shook her head.

"It's nothing."

All day.

That door remained firmly shut.

She could just make it to the bar on time.

"Anna, you're here!"

"We have a full house tonight."

"Everyone's waiting for you to take the stage."
###Chapter 116

Anna Ross gave a slight nod and followed the manager into the noisy interior of the bar.

Dazzling lights swirled. The dance floor was packed with a surging crowd, cheers rising and falling.

The moment she stepped onto the stage, all eyes from below focused on her.

Someone whistled. Others raised their phones to record.

The song request list was quickly handed to her.

As the intro music flowed softly, the entire room gradually quieted down.

Anna thanked her with surprise and simultaneously requested to leave early.

The night was still young. The streets remained lively.

###Chapter 117

"I don't believe that." Marcus Hill raised an eyebrow with a light laugh, his tone full of playful mockery. "Last time we met, you slapped me twice without any hesitation—such a feisty temper. Who else would dare to provoke you besides him?" He tilted his head, wearing an expression of someone enjoying the drama, a provoking smirk curling his lips.

Anna Ross couldn't be bothered to engage with him.
She had already apologized, yet he insisted on bringing it up repeatedly.
It wasn't intentional.
She didn't feel like explaining.

She just couldn't help wondering—where exactly had Adrian Sinclair gone? Even Marcus didn't know?
But it was better that he wasn't around.
She could clock out on time, without being ordered around by him.
Why bother thinking about him during such free days.

Anna gave a slight nod.
Mia hesitated for a few seconds before whispering, "Then I take back what I said earlier... about that incident. We really were in the wrong."

Anna couldn't help but laugh.
She was the one who did the hitting, and she was the one who apologized, yet Mia was the one getting anxious first.

"Fine." She linked arms with her best friend. "Let's just let them join us."
Mia coughed lightly, turning to the two men. "Since you know Anna—you can join us for dinner, but keep the chatter to a minimum."

Marcus grinned brightly.
He had just arrived in New York, and dinner was already settled!

The four of them sat down to eat, the atmosphere relaxed.
After a simple celebration, Anna and Mia got up to leave.
But Marcus stopped them. "Leaving already?"

"Going home." Anna checked the time. "Work tomorrow."

Sophia Roscente's eyes suddenly lit up. She rushed over and clung to Anna's arm, her voice soft and pleading. "Sis... can I go home with you?"

Anna was taken aback, glancing at Marcus.
Didn't he bring her here?
Marcus shrugged with a smile. "It's not appropriate for a grown man like me to take her back, could lead to misunderstandings—just do a good deed and let her stay with you for one night?"

He didn't dare take this young lady home.
If his family saw, he'd never be able to clear his name.

Anna looked hesitantly at Sophia.
She didn't want to bring her back.
If Adrian found out, he might use it as an excuse to cause trouble.

She was about to refuse—
But Sophia seemed to see right through her. Her eyes reddened, her lips trembling, on the verge of tears.

"Sis... if you don't take me in, I'll have to sleep on the streets tonight."
Anna and Mia exchanged a look, both at a loss.

Seeing this, Sophia pressed her advantage.
She batted her big, round eyes, softening her voice into a coaxing whine. "I promise I'll be good! I'll do whatever you say!"

Anna looked at her pitiful, obedient expression and her heart softened.
It was so late; she couldn't really let a young girl end up homeless.

###Chapter 118

Anna Ross looked at Sophia Roscente's expectant face and finally softened.

Fine, what harm could there be in letting her stay for one night?

By blood, they were cousins.

It made sense to look out for each other.

"Then come back with us," she said softly.

Sophia immediately jumped up with a cheer.

Before leaving, she happily waved goodbye to Marcus Hill.

"See you!"

Marcus stood watching as the three of them walked away.

His shadow stretched long under the streetlight.

He stood there for a moment before turning to leave.

Now he had to go back and face his family.

The thought alone made him irritable.

......

After parting ways with Mia Lawrence, only Anna and Sophia remained on the road.

They walked in silence.

Sophia was worried that if she was too noisy, she might be left on the roadside.

So she was unusually quiet.

Sophia followed Anna home happily.

Seeing the clean and tidy apartment, she couldn't help but exclaim.

"Wow, this place looks so cozy!"

She changed into slippers and ran inside.

Anna smiled at her childish behavior.

It had been a long time since she had seen someone so pure.

Sophia was like a breath of fresh air, always laughing.

If only she could be that carefree too.

Anna felt a little dazed.

She used to be a girl who laughed often.

But life was unpredictable, and some things just wore away the beauty.

She changed her shoes and walked inside.

She took a drink from the fridge and handed it to Sophia.

"Your family must be in New York too. Why aren't you going back?"

She really couldn't understand why Sophia wanted to come here with her.

Sophia took the drink and sighed.

"It's not that I don't want to go back. I can't."

This was the first time Anna had seen her look so sad.

"Why not?"

"I ran away from abroad."

"My parents forced me to study overseas, but I hated it there."

"So after they sent me, I just came back on my own."

She smiled like a clever little fox.

"Even though I came back, my mom is like a total dictator."

"She's super strict with me, so I absolutely can't let her know I'm back!"

Anna couldn't help but laugh at how she described her mother.

She liked Sophia's straightforward personality. It made things easy.

After resting for a while, Sophia looked at her curiously.

"But really, is there nothing going on between you and my cousin?"

"I always feel like there's more to it than meets the eye."

"Want to share?"

Anna immediately felt uneasy.

Mentioning Adrian Sinclair always made her tense.

She said calmly, "If we have any special relationship at all."

"It's that we're actually cousins too."

As she said this, her hands trembled slightly.

"What!?"

Sophia's eyes widened in shock.

She never expected them to be related.

Then she remembered her uncle talking about finding a wife.

She heard there was a stepdaughter.

So the person she thought her cousin liked was actually family.

Didn't that make her previous assumptions... wrong?

She quickly took a few gulps of her drink to calm down.
###Chapter 119

"It seems I'll have to change how I address you from now on." Sophia Roscente blinked, giving Anna Ross a playful look.

Anna hadn't expected her to say that and was slightly taken aback. "There's no need to change it. Just call me what you always have."

"How can that be okay?" Sophia shook her head with a serious expression. "I'm a good girl who knows the rules. If my family found out I was being disrespectful to you, I'd definitely get scolded!" Her eyes suddenly lit up as she affectionately linked arms with Anna. "How about I call you sister? I've always wanted to have an older sister!"

She quickly got into the passenger seat.

His lips were pressed into a thin line, his expression stern.

The receiver only emitted a busy signal.

Her small face crumpled with worry.

His voice was icy. "Take people and search. You must find her."

She remembered he had his own connections in New York.

More people searching would make it easier.

She just hoped Sophia was safe.

Still no answer.

Guilt washed over her.

She should have insisted Sophia come home last night.

"We ran into each other the last time she was in New York."

"We had a meal together. You weren't there then."

"She said she had nowhere to stay, so I took her in."

Adrian didn't ask any more questions.

Anna followed him out of the car.

Having someone familiar with the area was better than her searching blindly.

People were dancing wildly in the crowd.

They split up to search.

They scoured the entire bar but found nothing.

Adrian's expression grew increasingly grim.

They rushed to the next location.

They searched every place Sophia might possibly go.

Still, there was no sign of her.

Anna was filled with a sense of guilt.

"Maybe she's already back."

Anna was taken aback.

That was actually a good idea.

If all else failed, they could only call the police.

She nodded and took a taxi home.

Adrian continued searching outside.

Anna rushed to her apartment building.

She ran upstairs.

She found the door slightly ajar.

She pushed it open.

A phone was ringing on the sofa.

The sound of running water came from the bathroom.

Had she really come back?
###Chapter 132

"I just missed some calls."

Seeing her cousin's murderous glare.

She thought Adrian already knew about Sophia sneaking back.

Though unclear about their relationship.

Seeing Adrian's demeanor.

He must be very strict normally.

She worried she might have gotten Sophia into trouble.

Pouting like an angry little pufferfish.

Her eyes pleading desperately.

###Chapter 135

"He's never been good to you," Adrian's voice was laced with suppressed anger. "Is it worth it?" He found it bitterly ironic. He had used every means to tempt her, and she never yielded. Yet now she was lowering her head for the man who hurt her.

Why was she doing this?

Seeing his slightly raised brow, Anna's heart trembled.
She just wanted to hide herself away, wrapped up tightly like a cocoon.
But she couldn't.

Once dignity is discarded, it can never be reclaimed.

Adrian's voice rose. "Tell me, why?" Helping that kind of person was simply not worth it.

Why?
Anna was stunned. She didn't want to either, but she had no choice. "He's my stepfather. It's only right that I help him. I agree to be your mistress, as long as you let him go."

Adrian laughed at himself mockingly. "But I don't want that anymore." He fought back his anger, watching her degrade herself for that man. It made his chest feel tight and uncomfortable.

If it were someone else, would she do the same?

She reached out and wrapped her arms around him.

He didn't react.
Anna closed her eyes, stood on her toes, and kissed his lips.
A tear slid down from the corner of her eye.
His lips were still cold.

These were things he had once forced upon her.
Now she was doing them主动ly. Would he agree?

Adrian's pupils constricted sharply.
He pushed her away forcefully.
Looking at the stranger before him, his heart ached with a sharp pain.
If it was only for Howard Lowell, she didn't need to go this far.

Anna staggered from the push.
She couldn't let him leave.
This was her only chance.

Adrian stared at her stubborn expression, fury simmering in his dark eyes.

Is that what she thought of him?

Footsteps echoed. The next second, his hand closed around her wrist, gripping it tightly.

Anna looked up, meeting his angry eyes.
###Chapter 246

His lips pressed into a tight line.

Anger simmered in his eyes.

They stared at each other in silence.

The air grew thick and suffocating.

His knuckles were white from the pressure.

He saw the clear resentment in her eyes.

The glass was hurled onto the table.

It made a sharp, grating sound.

Anna's face turned pale.

Her fingers clutched tightly at the hem of her clothes.

Her knuckles turned white.

She had already dragged one person down.

She couldn't let another innocent person get hurt.

She would bear all the sin alone.

Since she was already deep in the mud.

What did she have to fear from eternal damnation.

Tears fell silently.

Leaving cold trails on her cheeks.

Adrian watched that single tear.

His heart felt as if it were being repeatedly pierced by a sharp blade.

The pain was numbing.

She was crying.

For another man.

When she had hurt him back then.

Had she felt even an ounce of reluctance?

Or in her heart.

Had he never been worth caring about?

Unwilling to look at her any longer.

Her gaze was empty. "As long as you don't hurt the people around me, I will do anything."

Adrian leaned back into the sofa.

He raised a hand to cover his eyes.

The setting sun cast its light through the window.

The dim, golden rays fell upon him.

Adding a layer of loneliness.

Two people who had once loved each other deeply.

Had actually come to this.

He had thought she was trapped by circumstances.

But it was just his own wishful thinking.

She could go this far for someone else.

Had she ever considered that he would feel heartache too?

In her eyes.

What exactly did he, Adrian Sinclair, amount to?

If he didn't still hold power and influence.

She would probably still be like she was three years ago.

Not even sparing him a single glance.

His Adam's apple moved with difficulty.

A faint redness tinged the corners of his eyes.

He lowered his head.

A self-mocking smile tugged at his lips.

Anna stared at him in a daze.

Her fingers curled unconsciously.

Was he upset?

That always proud Adrian Sinclair.

Could actually show such an expression.

Looking at his lean profile.

If it were before.

She would have gone to hug him.

But now.

She had long lost the right to do so.

She forced herself to look away.

As if that could lessen the dull ache in her chest.

"Since you say so." Adrian suddenly looked up.

His face had returned to its usual coldness. "Then show me your sincerity."

He gave her a cold glance. "Remember that hotel? Go wait for me there tonight."

Without waiting for her response.

His voice, sharp as an ice pick, spoke again. "Get out if there's nothing else."

Noah Watson was organizing files.

She kept making mistakes after several attempts.

She continued working.

She really was a one-drink wonder.

###Chapter 248

。。。。。。。。

###Chapter 249

###Chapter 251

This made her increasingly uneasy.

This was likely the calm before the storm.

She instinctively moved to protect her mother.

If he attacked now, she would fight him with everything she had.

Anna was still in shock.

She stared blankly at her mother.

Judging by their delighted expressions, it was probably true.

Adrian's attitude before clearly showed he wouldn't help.

Especially since he had overheard that phone call.

What exactly happened?

As she was lost in thought, Howard stood up.

He sat down next to the mother and daughter.

He sat close to her.

A meaningful smile never left his face.

"Anna, be honest with me. Have you already won over that Adrian kid?" His eyes gleamed shrewdly. His smile was full of calculation.

She just lowered her head.

Vivian gently patted her hand.

She said softly, "Anna, you two talk. I'll go wash some fruit."

She didn't want to be alone with Howard.

The plan was flawless.

Swallowing back the sob in her throat.

###Chapter 282

"While shopping today, I saw her with another man."

He stared at the photo in disbelief.

A tall man was affectionately ruffling the girl's hair.

His fingers tightened, veins bulging.

Under the light, his expression turned ferocious.

Good. Just perfect.

She never wanted to explain why they broke up.

It was because she had already found someone else.

He felt like a complete joke.

Always orbiting around her.

In her heart, he was probably just an annoying presence.

Chloe panicked, lifting her dress to stumble after him.

Her high heels clicked urgently against the floor.

Under the pavilion, Anna Ross was looking up at the moon.

The cold moonlight fell on her shoulders, outlining her slender back, making her appear even more solitary than the moon itself.

The moment his arms wrapped around her waist, she froze completely.

Adrian happened to chase out and witnessed the scene, his steps halting abruptly.

His Adam's apple bobbed, the lines of his profile sharp and cold as a blade.

A meaningful smile curved her red lips as she turned to chase after that tall, retreating figure.

With Lucas being such a helpful assist, he had saved her a lot of effort.

He stood frozen, his pupils trembling slightly.

"You'll meet someone better," she said, stepping back two paces before turning to leave decisively.

The hem of her dress swept over the stone steps, stirring a few scattered leaves.

Lucas stood alone in place, watching her retreating figure, a bitter smile tugging at his lips.

Inside the hall, the music and revelry continued, the noise grating on his ears.

He turned silently and disappeared into the thick night.

If not for her, this banquet had held no meaning for him from the start.
###Chapter 335

The night was as dark as ink.

As if it would never sleep.

Adrian Sinclair.

You are truly heartless.

Can you really not see my sincerity after all this time?

The pure white curtains fluttered incessantly.

The next morning.

###Chapter 337

Anna Ross walked for a long time against the night wind.

She thought she wouldn't want to see him again.

Could it be that she was developing feelings she shouldn't?

But he already had a girlfriend.

What was she thinking?

Was she going to become the kind of person she despised the most?

No matter what, she could not break someone else's relationship.

"What are you thinking about so deeply?"

"I thought you were asleep."

Adrian pushed the door open and came in.

He saw her frowning, occasionally pinching herself in a comical manner.
###Chapter 390

Anna Ross was startled.

She turned to look at the doorway.

Adrian Sinclair stood there.

"I thought you left?"

"Just took a phone call."

He asked a few questions.

"There's no way Anna can eat all this right now."

"Mind your tone with me."

Her eyes held a gentle smile.

###Chapter 391

On the other side.

Her family came on purpose.

Everything was ruined by Anna.

She hated her.

Adrian Sinclair. He was destined to be hers.

Lowell Group Headquarters.

Grandpa's stance remained firm.

In the hospital room.

Early the next morning.
Mia opened her eyes to see a simple room.
The gray sheets carried a masculine scent.
She suddenly remembered what happened last night.
She almost jumped out of bed.

She had actually fallen asleep just like that.
Who carried her to the bed?
Could it have been Julian Garnache?
Thinking of this, her entire body grew hot.
She felt like a thoroughly cooked shrimp.

Mia glanced at the time.
It was still early.
She decided to do something.

She dialed Anna Ross's number.
Anna Ross was being woken up by Adrian Sinclair.
She was busy preparing to go to the company for a project meeting.
She didn't notice the incoming call.

Mia waited for a while before hanging up.
She originally wanted to ask her friend about Julian Garnache's preferences.
Now she had to figure out what to buy on her own.

She gently pushed the door open.
No one was outside.
He should still be asleep.
She walked out quietly on tiptoe.

After looking around, she found there were no large supermarkets nearby.
She randomly bought some groceries and returned.
Pushing the door open, she saw Julian Garnache sitting on the sofa.

"Julian, you're awake?"
She changed into slippers and walked in carrying the groceries.

Julian Garnache had just woken up not long ago.
His hair was somewhat messy.
It inexplicably gave him a more languid momentum.
"Mia, what did you go out for?"

Mia held up the groceries in her hand.
"I went to buy some food."
"I'll cook later."
She put the groceries in the refrigerator.
She picked out a few items and walked into the kitchen.

Julian Garnache watched her retreating figure.
His expression was somewhat dazed.
After a moment of silence, he walked towards the bathroom.

It had been a long time since he last felt this way.
The feeling of someone cooking for him and waiting for him.
###Chapter 424

Anna Ross unlocked her phone screen in the afternoon.

Sunlight slanted through the car window, falling on her weary fingertips.

She was so exhausted that even her breath felt heavy.

The negotiation had been unusually difficult.

The other party refused to yield, their words sharp and unrelenting.

The impulsive words from last night still echoed in his ears.

All she wanted was to return to the hotel and sink into a soft pillow.

"Next time," she declined softly, maintaining a polite smile.
###Chapter 425

Mark said nothing more, quietly finishing his meal.

The wheels of their luggage screeched against the floor.

On the plane.

Lulling everyone into drowsiness.

Following behind Adrian as usual.

Trying her best not to intrude on their space.

She always did this.

Unknowingly tugging at his heart.

Following his gaze.

Her mother was always like this, always putting her child first.

Noah hesitated. "Nothing urgent. Please let her rest well."

After hanging up, Mia felt slightly relieved.

It seemed her colleague was quite considerate.

Julian sat on a chair by the wall, making a call.

His brows were furrowed, his expression serious.

Mia secretly admired his handsome profile.

After last night's events, her heart raced whenever she saw him now.

Julian suddenly turned.

Their eyes met briefly before quickly looking away.

Mia pressed a hand to her chest.

Her heart felt like it was about to leap out.

They kept vigil at the hospital the entire night.

When Anna woke, she found Mia asleep with her head resting on the bedside.

Julian on the other side immediately stirred awake. "Anna, you're awake?"

Anna softly hummed in response, not wanting to wake her friend.

She tried to move her numb right hand, and Mia immediately woke up.

"Anna, you're finally awake!" Mia exclaimed joyfully, grasping her hand.

Anna nodded, a dull pain throbbing at her temple.

Seeing their concerned expressions, she leaned back against the pillows.

Mia suddenly lowered her head. "I'm sorry. I got you hurt again."

Anna suppressed the pain and managed a weak smile. "It's just a minor injury. It's nothing."

She patted her friend's hand and turned to Julian. "Julian, what exactly happened last night? Why were you in a fight?"

Julian ran a hand through his hair in frustration.

Mia spoke up first. "It's not his fault. I went to a bar to meet a friend and some creeps started getting handsy..."

"Mia, are you okay?"
###Chapter 500

Anna Ross's heart tightened.

She immediately grabbed Mia Lawrence's hand.

Her gaze anxiously scanned the other girl's entire body.

"Are you hurt?"

Mia's eyes instantly reddened.

She hugged Anna tightly.

Her voice was choked with emotion.

"Anna... You're injured this badly yourself."

"Yet you're only worried about me."

Anna gently patted her back.

A faint curve touched the corner of her mouth.

"It's really nothing."

"It doesn't hurt anymore."

Julian Garnache silently handed them two glasses of warm water.

Cold fury still simmered in the depths of his eyes.

"Men have been sent to catch those guys."

"They won't get away."

He was always calm and controlled.

But last night, he lost control.

The moment he saw Anna being pushed down.

Rage burned through his reason.

His fists moved faster than his thoughts.

Anna took the glass.

Her fingertips trembled slightly.

The chaos of last night still swirled in her mind.

The hospital room door suddenly swung open.

Noah Watson rushed in, breathless.

His eyes immediately landed on the bandage on Anna's head.

His face instantly paled.

"How bad is it?"

Anna shook her head.

"What are you doing here?"

He should have been at the company at this hour.

Noah took a deep breath.

His gaze swept over the three people in the room.

His tone became hesitant.

"Mr. Sinclair contacted me just now."

"I was about to call and tell you."

"I heard you were in the hospital..."

He paused.

His brow furrowed tightly.

"What exactly happened?"

Anna's fingertips clenched sharply.

The water in her glass swayed gently.

She lifted her eyes.

Her voice was very soft.

"Where is he?"

Noah avoided her gaze.

His Adam's apple bobbed.

"Mr. Sinclair only sent a message."

"He told me to keep a close watch on the company."

"And also..."

"And what else?" Anna pressed.

Noah was silent for a long time.

Finally, he spoke with difficulty.

"He might... not be coming back."

The room fell abruptly silent.

Mia gasped in shock.

"What do you mean, not coming back?"

Anna tried to sit up.

But a sharp pain in her head made her gasp.

"Why?"

Her voice trembled.

"Where did he go?"

Noah just shook his head.

His eyes were full of complexity.

Mia suddenly understood.

"Is it because he misunderstood you?"

"Does he feel too ashamed to face you?"

Anna stood frozen in place.

Her heart felt as if gripped by an invisible hand.

Those past events were long over.

Why was he still holding onto them?

Noah spoke in a low, comforting tone.

"Ms. Ross, focus on recovering first."

"When Mr. Sinclair figures things out."

"He will naturally return."

Anna forced a smile.

Her nails dug deeply into her palms.

"Okay."

But her mind was in turmoil.

Where on earth could he have gone?

The sunlight outside the window was faint.

Not like the overcast rain of the past few days.

The light, though weak, was bright enough.

It dispelled the oppression of the previous days.

Anna suddenly lifted her head.

A faint glimmer flashed in her eyes.

She remembered a place.
